loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: El señor Jesús L. es comerciante el se dedica a la venta de marisco fresco los cuales prepara muy deliciosos. El ofrece la venta de coctel de camarón, ceviche, ostión, pulpo y campechana que contiene de todo a un buen precio, su negocio lo tiene en una camioneta acondicionada con hieleras para vender su producto fresco. Esta actividad la realiza con gusto ya que tiene más de 24 años con su venta la cual le va muy bien. El pide del apoyo para poder surtir más su negocio y así generar mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Jesús L. sells fresh seafood. He prepares the seafood, and it is very delicious. He sells shrimp cocktail, “ceviche” (raw fish cooked in lime juice), oysters, octopus, and “campechana” (a mixture of everything). He sells at a good price. He has his business in a van, which has been equipped with coolers to keep the products fresh. He enjoys his work. He has been selling seafood for 24 years, and it is going very well for him. He is requesting help to be able to stock his business more. That way he will generate more income

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Petesa

texts.en:
Petesa M. L. is 38 and married with seven children aged between three and sixteen. She owns a business venture planting and harvesting coconuts for sale. Petesa has two years of experience in this business. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 320 WST) to improve and expand her business.
In 2010, Petesa joined Kiva partner, SPBD. This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Petesa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. Visit http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Mrs. Touch Sam Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has seventeen people who have selected Mrs. Touch S. as a village bank president. Mrs. S. was born in 1963 and is located in Chrouy village, Takeo province. Each member of the group will use their portion of the loan in various ways to increase their income for this current year. Mrs. Touch S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. She is also a Khmer cake seller, door-to-door. She is a widow with a child who is a laborer. She tries to work a lot but she earns very little to support her family's living costs. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Touch S. is seeking for a loan to buy three piglets for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy three piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Mrs. Thear Pok Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has sixteen people who live in Chrouy village, Takeo province. Mrs. Thear P., 36 years old, is a village bank president as selected by the other members. Each group member will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. P. is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land where she grows crops to sell to support her family while her husband, Mr. Khorn Nget, is a vice village chief. He is also gem mining. Her problem is that her field has infertile soil, and she did not have enough money to support the crops. So to improve her production, Mrs. Thear P. is seeking for a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed. She is a mother of four children who are all enrolled in a local public school and they are helping their parents businesses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina C. is 62 years old, married, and has seven adult-aged children. She is from the village of Sapang Ama, Sapang Dalaga. To make a living, Avelina owns and operates a business venture weaving nipa (to make a thatched roof from the leaves of the nipa palm). She has been engaged in her business for eight years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month.
In 2006, Avelina joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,500 PHP from PMPC. Avelina is requesting a new loan of 10,500 PHP, which will be used as additional working capital for her business. This loan will be her seventh from PMPC.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional working capital for her business

texts.en:
Niza D. is from the village of Zayas, Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 38 years old. Niza is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Niza owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling specialty food products like home made sausage and egg pies in the local community. Niza has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Niza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Niza is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Niza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Naseem Akhter's Group

texts.en:
Naseem Akhter has lived in a city called Borewala for many years. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. She is a housewife and stays at home, manages the household chores and takes care of her family. She is the mother of two sons and a daughter. Two of them are studying while her eldest son left school after matriculation and started a spare parts business to support the family. 

Her husband deals with medicines. He sells the medicines to medical shops and clinics as well. He has been doing this work for over ten years. He purchases medicines wholesale which reduces his expense of traveling and gives him good profit.  

Naseem has applied for a loan from Asasah for her nephew who also lives with her. With the loan he will buy used mobile phones for his mobile phone selling business. He also sells prepaid mobile cards to his customers. Naseem is hopeful that her nephew’s income will be increased with the help of this investment in his business.

loans.use: Purchase used mobile phones & prepaid mobile phone cards to resell

loans.name: Rafiqan's Group

texts.en:
Rafiqan lives in a city called Borewala in Pakistan with her family. She is the mother of two sons who couldn’t get their education due to financial constraints.  Rafiqan sews clothes by taking orders from her neighboring clients. She works ful time but also carried out her responsibilities as a housewife. 

Her husband has a business of selling timber. He has a shop in the market where he sells his product. Being located in the market everybody easily approaches him to buy timber. He has been doing this business for the last thirty years. Rafiqan’s eldest sons also help his father in his business. He helps him by attending to the customers.  

Rafiqaan has applied for a loan for the first time from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount he will buy timber in bulk and be able to fulfill larger orders on time.  Rafiqaan hopes that it will be a good experience for her husband’s business and he will get good benefit from it.

loans.use: Purchase timber to resell

loans.name: Sugran's Group

texts.en:
Sugran lives in a city called Borewala, famous for its shrines in Pakistan. She is a caring lady, and carries out her responsibilities as a housewife. She doesn’t have any children. 

Her husband, S. B., works in the fields to earn a profit for his family. He is the only breadwinner. He produces wheat in his field. By putting much efforts in growing the wheat, he is able to generate a good income.   It is not easy to work in the scorching heat all the day but her husband is a hard worker and doesn’t care about the weather. 

Sugran has applied for a loan for the third time from Asasah for her husband. With the loan he will buy seeds and fertilizer for his fields. She is hopeful that this investment will help her husband  get better results from his field which will result in increased profit.  With her previous loan, Sugran has maintained good a credit rating and never missed a single meeting.

loans.use: Purchase seeds & fertilizer for growing wheat in the field

loans.name: Kaneez's Group

texts.en:
Kaneez is a housewife and lives with her family in a city called Borewala, in Pakistan, famous for its shrines.  She has spent most of her life there. 
She is the mother of four children, two sons and two daughters. Her eldest son supports the family by doing embroidery while other three are getting their education. 

Kaneez is very supportive in nature, she used to help her son in preparing the embroidered dresses when he receives large orders for but must be completed on time.  

She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband who runs a video-game shop in the community. With the loan he will buy new video games for his shop. He has been in this business for over seven years and earns a good income from it because. There is good potential in this business.
 
Kaneez is hopeful that by adding more variety of video games, her husband will be able to earn extra income which will be used to enhance the family’s living standard and help in completing the children’s education.

loans.use: Purchase video games for a video-game shop

loans.name: Kalimahan

texts.en:
Kalimahan K. is 47 years old.  She lives in Ak-Dobo village in the north of Kyrgyzstan and has four children: one son, who is married and lives on his own, two daughters who are students, and one son of school age. 

Kalimahan has a higher teacher's education, and during the last twenty-four years she has been working as a teacher of the German language in a local school.  She is characterized by her colleagues as a responsible, precise and sociable person.  Also, Kalimahan is a member of the non-government organization named “Planet -21” and takes part in implementing the project of greenhouse construction.   Kalimahan’s husband works in the local school as a physical training teacher. 

Unfortunately, salaries of teachers in rural areas are very low.  That’s why in 1995 Kalimahan, using her starting capital of 17,000 KGS, began to engage in stock-breeding. She bought milk cows, whose milk she sold to her customers at the local market.  Also, Kalimahan‘s family began to cultivate kidney beans, potatoes and red beets on a plot of land. They worked hard to get a good harvest. Using the revenues from selling the harvest, Kalimahan paid for the education of her children. 

Kalimahan  plans to use this loan of 60,000 KGS to buy three sheep and one milk cow. She expects to increase the sales of milk and also acquire new customers. With the revenue from the loan, she plans to buy a car for transporting vegetables to the local market.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Micro-finance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow and three sheep

loans.name: Siavii

texts.en:
Siavii E. is 50 years old and married with 6 children between the ages of 7 and 25.  She owns a business venture, providing new clothing services to local community members.  She has four years of experience in this business.  

Siavii needs a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase additional fabrics and materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be about $150 per week) to improve the business.

In 2007, Siavii joined SPBD, and this is her 4th loan with them. SPBD's loans are Siavii's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD:

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD, and since then it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.name: Terlan

texts.ru:
Terlan I. 60 let. On jenat i yeqo semya sostait iz trex dochek i odnoqo sina. Samoy starshey doshke uje 32 qoda ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey. Dochka 29 let toje zamujem i imeyet 2 detey, a dochka 27 let ona rabotayet i uchitsya. Sin Terlana toje jenat i imeyet 2 dochek. Terlan i eqo semya ochen drujniye.

Terlan uje 15 let kak rabotayet v etom biznese ,On sajayet frukti (yabloko, qrusho i t,d) a potom sobirayet i prodayet ix na rinke. Terlan ochen lubit svoyu rabotu, on lubit uxajivat za derevyami ,polivat ix, sobirat frukti. Seychas Terlan nujdayetysa v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit udobreniye i pesticidi dlya uvilicheniya urojaya.
texts.en:
Terlan I. is 60 years old. He is married and has three daughters and one son. The oldest daughter is already 32 years old. She is married and has 2 children. The 29-year-old daughter is also married and has 2 children, and the 27-year-old daughter works and studies. Terlan's son is also married and has 2 daughters. Terlan and his family are very friendly. Terlan has been working in this business for 15 years. He plants fruits (apples, pears, etc.), then picks and sells fruit at a market. Terlan loves his work very much. He loves taking care of trees, watering and picking fruit. Currently, Terlan needs 2000 AZN in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for increasing the harvest.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and pesticides

Rita Marie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Rita Marie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Paz Village, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Rosene

texts.en:
Rosene B. is from the village of Libon, Gingoog City. She is 25 years old. Rosene is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Rosene owns & operates a business venture in the services sector providing recycling services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling bottles, plastics & other recyclables for local businesses and community members. Rosene has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosene is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional plastics & other recyclables to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Rosene from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional plastics & other recyclables to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna V. is from the village of Binakalan, Gingoog City. She is 44 years old and married with one adult child. To make a living, Edna has a business providing pedicures and manicures. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Edna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the first loan taken out by Edna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene P. is from the village of Pedlagahan, Gingoog City. She is 37 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Arlene owns a sari-sari (variety) shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Arlene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Arlene from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden D. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 39 years old. Eden is separated from her spouse and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Eden owns a sari-sari (variety) shop selling both food and daily use products and fruit. Eden has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Eden joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Eden from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Fail

texts.ru:
Fail M. 42 qoda. On ne jenat i jivet v qorode Fuzuli region. U neqo yest 2 brata i odna sestra. On jivet vmeste so svoimi roditelyami.

Fail ochen lubit jivotnix i poeotmu 4 qoda tomu nazad on nachal derjat korov i prodovat moloko delat iz neqo sir, tvoroq. Etomu biznesu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo otca. Ranshe on rabotal v maqazine no potom reshil pomenyat biznes. Vse sosedi Faila pokupayut moloko u neqo, tak kak korov u neqo malo i oni ne dayut mnoqo moloka i Fail seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi.
texts.en:
Fail M. is 42 years old. He is single and lives in a town in the Fuzuli region. He has 2 brothers and one sister. He lives together with his parents. Because Fail loves animals, he started a business of keeping cows, selling milk and making cheese products 4 years ago. He learned this business from his father. Previously, he worked at a store, but then decided to go into another business. All of Fail's neighbors buy milk from him. Because Fail does not own many cows, they cannot produce a lot of milk, and Fail now needs 2000 AZN in order to buy cows.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en: Mrs. Chheng Chhut is 34 years old and married to Mr. Thy who is 43. The couple lives with five children who are students. They work selling fresh fish that they catch from Tunle Sap Lake. They get up in the dark to go fishing and hurry to bring their fish to sell in the local market for daily profit. The family living conditions are not good because their house is cracked and leaks in a heavy rainfall. To help solve the problem, Chheng Chhut is applying for a loan in order to mend her old house.

loans.use: To mend her old house.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 25 year-old single man. He started carpentry when he was 18 years old. As a member of Faulu Kenya, he has been motivated to work hard in his business which has improved since he took out a loan of 20,000 KES.  At least, he can now afford to pay his two employees. Patrick has requested a loan of 40, 000 KES to buy wood to make furniture. He hopes to stabilize his business in five years.

loans.use: To buy wood to make furniture

loans.name: Duch

texts.en:
Duch R. is 24 years old and is married to Horm Ty, 34, who works at fishing in and around the lakes of his community.

Duch R. has been selling fresh fish in the busy local market for more than five years. She sells fish that she gets from her husband’s fishing or buys them from her wholesale supplier or from other fishermen.

Currently, the fishing is temporarily interrupted because their fishing equipment is broken. Because of this, Duch R. requested a loan in order to buy additional fishing equipment, including nets and traps.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing equipment for her husband, including nets and traps

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en:
Battsetseg B. is 50 years old and lives with her husband in their own ger, a traditional nomadic housing tent, in Zavhan province, western Mongolia. She has four children but all of them now live separately from their parents.

Battsetseg operates a vegetable trading business where, with the help of her husband, she sells a variety of vegetables to customers at a local market. She started her business in 2001 and sells many different kinds of vegetables.

During the past nine years Battsetseg has not only gained business experience and knowledge but also agricultural experience and knowledge. She and her family store a large amount of vegetables in a warehouse which they built themselves.

Battsetseg is a modest, creative woman who is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a great deal of vegetables at wholesale prices so that she can grow her customer base this autumn and winter.

loans.use: To purchase a great deal of vegetables at wholesale prices

loans.name: Seab

texts.en:
Fishing is the most important part of 26-year-old Seab S.’s daily work. She and her husband have been living on a fishing boat on the river for more than nine years. They support their two children who are attending school

This couple wakes up every morning, drives their boat toward the middle of the river, and then fishes. After the fishing is done, they hurry to bring their fish to the market to sell to their regular buyers on credit. They collect their money after their buyers sell all of the fish that they bought.

Seab S. and her husband assert that some of their fishing equipment is ruined and they hope to buy additional equipment. This is why Seab S. looks for a $500 loan.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing equipment

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 40 years old and is married to an accountant. She is blessed with four children: Andrew 19, Clarence 15, Charles 10 and Maxwell 2.

Rachel has been operating a retail shop for seven months. In her business, she has employed one person.

Rachel is a member of Stima group in Faulu Kenya whose members guarantee each other’s loans. She has previously managed to take out a loan of 20,000 KES to add to her stock.

Rachel has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to add to her stock of sugar, wheat flour, soda and maize flour. She hopes to open a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To add to her stock of sugar, wheat flour, soda and maize flour

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
The young man shown in the photo is Mr. Lang K., 22, a fisherman. He usually needs to take eight hours a day to fish in and around the Tunle Sap River. He catches around 10 kilos of fish per day and sells them in bulk to his customers who are retail sellers in the market.

Lang’s wife’s name is Sinath; she is 20 and works with him in the fishing business. The young couple is blessed with two young kids who are still not enrolled in school.

Lang will use his loan to purchase nets, traps, and other fishing equipment so that he can catch more fish.

loans.use: To purchase nets, traps, and other fishing equipment

loans.name: Badamdorj

texts.en:
Badamdorj J. is 55 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Hovd province, western Mongolia. He and his family all live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His eldest son is a driver, while the youngest daughter attends a local primary school.

Badamdorj operates a small cafe in his town with the help of his wife. Badamdorj started his cafe in 2008 and for the future, he hopes to expand his business. The two have purchased a plot of land with their business earnings, and have already started building a house on it. In order to expand his business, Badamdorj needs some funding for purchasing a car, by which he plans to transport passengers throughout his town. He is requesting a 2,650,000 MNT loan in order to buy a car for increasing his business line and type.

loans.use: To purchase a car.

loans.name: Dom

texts.en: Dom S. is 54 years old and has been selling a few fresh fish in the local busy market for more than fourteen years. She sells fish that she gets from her wholesale supplier and other fishermen. She is a single mother who is blessed with eight children. Five of them are now married and live separately, while the remaining three are single. Dom S. will be using her loan to increase the financial capital of her fish investment.

loans.use: To increase the financial capital of her fish investment.

loans.name: Erdenebaatar

texts.en:
Erdenebaatar G. is 33 years old and lives with his wife and son in Zavhan province, western Mongolia. He and his family live in a house.

Erdenebaatar works as a driver in the local police department, while his wife manages a cell phone business in their town. He and his wife started their business two years ago, and have made much progress with their business over the last year and have built a strong customer base. Erdenebaatar and his wife have gained much experience operating their business and dream of one day owning their own repair shop and cell phone store in their town. Erdenebaatar is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase cellphones and cellphone parts from Ereen, a border city of China, in order to increase his business sales.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Kang

texts.en: Mrs. Kang S. has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops on her own land, from which she earns a living. Her husband assists her with the farm work. Kang S. has been married for years and has eight children. Six of her children are married and employed, and the other two are single and attend school. Kang S. lacks farm supplies to use on her field during the coming season. To help meet her goals, Kang S. has applied for a loan in order to buy fertilizers and crop seeds to grow.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and crop seeds to grow.

loans.name: 16-03-04-Dong Hai Group

texts.en:
Thiem L. T. (12) is a 41 year old femaL. living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Thiem is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 04-Dong Hai (16-03-04-Dong Hai).

Thiem is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, Thiem operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting rice for saL.. Thiem has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2.500.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2006, Thiem joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thiem has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. The loan will be the 6th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thiem plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  L. T. Mai (99) is a 31 year old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising crops.
2.  T. T. Gam (108) is a 36 year old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising crops.
3.  L. T. Mai (32) is a 32 year old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising crops.
4.  L. T. Nhan (2) is a 50 year old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Thiem L. T. (12) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Thiem là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 04-Dong Hai (16-03-04-Dong Hai).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ trồng & thu hoạch gạo để bán.  Thiem thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 15 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Thiem kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND.  Vào 2006, Thiem đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Thiem đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua phân bón như phân chuồng.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  L. T. Mai (99) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là trồng cây lương thực.
2.  T. T. Gam (108) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là trồng cây lương thực.
3.  L. T. Mai (32) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là trồng cây lương thực.
4.  L. T. Nhan (2) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson is a 40-year-old hardworking and focused man. He is married and the father of three.

Peterson has a van which he uses for a transport business. He has been engaged in the business for thirteen years and has two employees.

Peterson appreciates being associated with a group in Faulu Kenya because he has gained new business skills.

Currently, Peterson’s van is in bad condition. Therefore, he has requested a 20,000 KES loan to buy two tires, repair the seats and the clutch plate and do other service jobs.

Peterson hopes to own more vans for transport in the future.

loans.use: To buy two tires, repair the seats and clutch plate and do other service jobs

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 39-year-old married lady with four children who are in school.

Regina sells second-hand clothes to earn a living and has been in the business for one year. She also farms for more income.

Regina is a member of Ametoni group in Faulu Kenya whose members guarantee each other’s loans. She has requested a 20,000 KES loan to add to her stock of clothes.

Regina dreams of providing a quality education to her children. She hopes to be the major supplier of clothes in her local community.

loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hasbagana

texts.en:
Hasbagana M. is 38-years-old and lives with his wife and three children in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia, in their own ger, a traditional nomadic housing tent. His wife works as a hairdresser in her district and the elder two children attend a district middle school while the youngest child goes to a kindergarten.

Hasbagana owns a successful microbus taxi service which he began in 1996. Now he hires a driver who transports people to the western part of Ulaanbaatar city while Hasbagana manages rural transportation using his own van. He is known as a reliable, friendly driver who takes great care of his passengers. For the future, he wishes to continue paying for his children’s education and would eventually like to build his own home.

Hasbagana is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase parts for his microbus so that he can keep it in good running condition.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his microbus

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married lady with three children. She has been farming for the past twenty-one years, rearing chickens and dairy cows. She sells milk in her local community and has one employee.

Josephine joined Maarifa group in Faulu Kenya so as to get financial support. This is because the group members guarantee each other’s loans. In the group, she also saves her money.

Josephine is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to buy animal feeds. She hopes that, someday, she will have a decent home.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mrs. V. has been in the farming business for years. She raises various crops and pigs on her own land, from which she earns a living.

V. has been married for years and has three kids. Two of them are enrolled in school and other one is a baby. Her husband assists her with the farm work.

V. requests a loan to purchase wood to mend and decorate her old house.

loans.use: To purchase wood to mend and decorate her old house

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Narantsetseg H. is 33 years old and lives with her mother and son in Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. She and her family live together in their own 2-room apartment. Her mother is retired while the son attends a primary school in their district. 

Narantsetseg began her clothing business in 2005 and after several years of hard work, she was able to increase the number of stalls where she has been selling her products. Narantsetseg wants to expand the business even further by introducing new product lines from China. With these new product lines, she hopes to grow her customer base even further and dreams tof purchasing a car out of her business revenue. 

Narantsetseg is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT loan so that she can begin to import these new product lines from China.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is 30 years old and married with one child.  For four years, he has been operating a retail shop.  He is also a taxi driver.  He has been an active member of 'Brotherhood' group under Faulu Kenya.  In this group, he saves his money.  He has previously serviced one loan from Faulu Kenya which he used to increase his stock.  He is requesting 30,000 KES to buy sugar, rice and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and maize flour.

loans.name: Ke

texts.en:
Mrs. Ke Y. is a 47-year-old rice grower and local farmer from the Kompong Tom Province. She runs her business on her own farmland, where she raises rice crops and pigs. She will sell them to a buyer when they have matured. Her husband helps her with the farm work.

 Ke Y. has two children who are secondary students. With the rainy season approaching and the heavy rains falling, it is a good time for planting. Ke Y. is looking for a loan to use on her farm.

loans.use: To use on her farm.

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr: A. est une jeune femme dynamique qui exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de friperie, il fait ce commerce depuis plus de 6 ans déjà. il s'approvisionne au marché local de hedzranawoé à Lomé. elle exerce cette activité dans une petite boutique. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes qui sont pour la plupart des jeunes filles et garçons. elle sollicite de WAGES un prêt pour accroître son stock et réaliser de plus grosse recette. elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. A. is a dynamic young woman who makes a living selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this line of business for over six years already. She stocks up at the local Hedzranawoé market in Lomé. She sells her goods in a small store. Her customer base is very diverse, mostly consisting of young people. She is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to increase her stock and to achieve a better revenue margin. She is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing used clothing

loans.name: Sandagsuren

texts.en:
Sandagsuren T. is 37 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Zavhan province of western Mongolia. Both of his children go to a local kindergarten while his wife works as a stock keeper in a local private company. 

Sandagsuren manages his own iron/metal work business where he produces such items as stoves, stove pipes, smokestacks, and so on. He began his business in 2003 and has gained much experience over the years. He says, “My dream is to expand my business and establish a workshop of my own.” 

Sandagsuren is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan in order to purchase raw materials for making stoves and other items for the upcoming winter months.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel is 30 years old and married to a policeman.  She is blessed with two daughters, aged 10 and 1.  She owns and operates Mabel N. Knitting Shop where she sells cosmetics and jewelry and provides knitting services. She has engaged in the business for two years.  She is also employed as a primary school teacher. 

Mabel was previously employed as a quality assurance inspector.  She joined 'Mercy' group in Faulu Kenya so as to access loans.  She has requested her first loan of 20,000 KES from Faulu Kenya.  With the loan, she will purchase knitting thread and jewelry.  She hopes to expand her business and employ many people.  She describes herself as sociable and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy knitting thread and jewelry

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
Mrs. C. earns a living by raising pigs and rice on a land next to her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. In addition, she assists her husband catch fish from the river. The couple has seven children, five are now married and other two are single. 

C. has a son who is employed, but he always is concerned that he faces difficulty travelling to work because he doesn’t have his own vehicle. To solve this problem, C. has applied for a $500 loan in order to purchase a secondhand motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase a secondhand motorcycle.

loans.name: Tsengel

texts.en:
Tsengel G. is 36 years old and lives with her husband and two children Hovd province, western of Mongolia in their own ger--a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her husband works as a truck driver in their town while the two children attend a local middle school. 

Tsengel operates a fruit retail business in her town with the help of her husband. She began her business in 2000 and since then has gained much experience in the business. Tsengel and her husband are a very hardworking couple who have been trying their best to build their own house with their fruit sales profits. Tsengel is requesting a 3,500,000 Mongolian tugrug (MNT) loan to purchase a large amount of fruit and all kinds of vegetables, which she will resell at retail prices.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Koffi Wonyadou

texts.fr: A. koffi est un homme très dynamique, il exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits génériques, il a commencé ce commerce il y a de cela  7 mois. ce commerce marche bien pour lui, sa clientèle ne cesse de grandir, il voudrait par conséquent gonfler son stock pour satisfaire tous ses clients et réaliser de bonnes recettes. il sollicite alors de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de divers produits génériques. il est marié et père de 2 enfants.
texts.en:
Koffi A. is a very energetic man. His line of business is the sale of generic products. He started this business around 7 months ago. This business has been going well for him and his clientele continues to grow. Consequently, he would like to increase his stock to satisfy his customers and to make a good income. Thus, he is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy various generic products. He is married and the father of 2 children.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy generic products

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam Y. is a modest villager living in Kompong Tom Province. She is fifty-two years old and married with two children, one is married and the other is attending school. Sam Y. generates her daily income by selling snack cakes and other grocery items to neighbors and passers-by. She started her business years ago and makes a daily profit of around $3. Her husband has been operating a business of driving a horse-cart taxi. Since she sold nearly all her items, Sam Y. wants to restock by asking for a loan to purchase addition grocery inventory to continue selling.

loans.use: Grocery store inventory

loans.name: Tsevelmaa

texts.en:
Tsevelmaa T. is 44 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Zavhan province, western of Mongolia in their own ger--a traditional nomadic housing tent. Tsevelmaa's husband works for a local energy industry, her elder daughter is a student, and the youngest daughter attends a local primary school. 

Tsevelmaa currently operates two separate business in the city. Her primary focus is selling vegetables that she grows on her plot of land with the help of her family. She sells them at one of the largest markets, called Urgamal, in her town. 

She also works as a driver, transporting people back and forth in her town in the mornings and evenings. Tsevelmaa started her businesses in 1999 and made quick progress. She is a hard-working and optimistic woman who is always looking for ways to expand her businesses.  She is requesting a 2,000,000 Mongolian tugrug (MNT) loan to help purchase construction materials to build a warehouse, where the family will store vegetables to be sold during the winter season.

loans.use: To build a warehouse

loans.name: Chheim

texts.en: Mrs. Chheim T. is 36 and lives in the best territory of Kompong Tom Province, in Cambodia Country. She is a local chef. She is always hired by neighbors to cook meals for their wedding parties and other ceremonies. In addition, she takes time to cultivate rice for both eating and selling. She was married but divorced her husband when her two kids were young. Chheim T. is applying for a loan to buy a cow that she will use to plow the farmland and for breeding.

loans.use: purchasing a cow for plowing the farm and for breeding

loans.name: Sargsyan

texts.en:
M. Sargsyan lives in the village of Pokr Mantash in the Shirak region.  She is married and very proud of her two sons (23 and 27 years old).  M. has been engaged in cattle breeding for the past 18 years and with the income from her business supports her family.  She also helps her relatives living in Artik with the proceeds of her business. 

 M. has chosen to expand her business and is seeking a loan to purchase additional calves.  She expects the family income to increase by 30% with the business loan.  M. was born in Pokr Mantash and would like to continue living in her village.  By growing her business she hopes to improve the future of her family.

loans.use: purchase additional calves

loans.name: Yanjmaa

texts.en:
Yanjmaa T. is 43 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Zavhan province, western Mongolia, in their own house. Her husband works in a local bakery industry and the elder daughter works as a cleaner while the younger two children attend a local high school. 

Yanjmaa operates a taxi service between the countryside and the capital of the province. She started her business in 2008 with a small car. After a few successful years in business, she has gained much experience and a good reputation among her customers. Yanjmaa works very hard to provide for her family and to pay her children's tuition fees. She says, “My only wish is to support my children’s education and have them become good people."

 Yanjmaa is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase parts for her automobile.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for her car

loans.name: Kol

texts.en: The woman in the photo is Mrs. Kol R., age 41, who lives in the Province of Kompong Tom in Cambodia, where she earns a living raising pigs and crops. Since 1984, she has run this business and it has provided her with income to attain her standard of living. She has a life partner in her husband who works in construction. She is married with five kids who are going to school and also work. In order to earn extra income, Kol R. will be using the loan to buy more piglets and crop seeds to raise.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and crop seeds to raise.

loans.name: Que Teekeh. Group

texts.en:
Philip M., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'Que Teekeh'. He is 35 years old, married, and has three children whose ages are between 2 to 13 years old. He was only able to attend school through 9th grade due to lack of financial support. Philip cares for one sibling.   

For 8 years, he has been selling soap, biscuits, milk, soft drinks and tea in Smart Road Community in Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more soap, biscuits, milk, soft drinks and tea. 

He describes himself as a devoted family man. His dream is to grow his business and continue to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more soap, biscuits, milk, soft drinks and tea.

loans.name: Saraphina

texts.en:
Saraphina is a mother of five aged 36, 31, 30, 28 and 26.  She managed to see her children through school.  For thirty years, she has been operating a food stall where she mainly sells porridge.  She has employed two people. 

Saraphina is a single mother and hence she works hard to make ends meet. Therefore, she built her own houses which she rents out for extra income.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has managed to sustain her business.  This is because she previously took out seven loans from Faulu Kenya which she used to boost the business. She has requested another loan of 30,000 KES to buy ingredients for cooking.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for cooking

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
Martha D., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called In God We Trust.
Martha is 38 years old, married, and has three children aged from 5 to 17 years old. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support.
For the last 15 years, Martha has been selling drinks (liquor), milk and soap at Thinkers Village Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more drinks (liquor), milk and soap. Martha describes herself as a hard-working person. Her goal is to improve her business, build a house, and continue to educate her children.
In the photo that accompanies this profile, Nancy is inset lower right because she was absent during loan disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more drinks (liquor), milk and soap

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine N. is 45 years old and lives in the town of Bombo in the Luwero region of Uganda.  She is married and has 5 children, who are in school.  Christine has a poultry farm, which she has had for 3 years as a business.  

To help expand her business, Christine is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy supplies for the poultry farm.  Christine hopes that the loan will help her by allowing her to produce more and earn income for her family.  In the future, Christine hopes to open up additional types of businesses.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the poultry farm

loans.name: Kimba Children. Group

texts.en:
Alice K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'K. Children'. Alice is 42 years old, married, and has five children who range from 10 to 25 years old. She is a college student. She cares for two siblings.

For 8 years, she has been selling rice, oil and sardines in Thinkers' Village Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6, 000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of rice, oil and sardines.

She describes herself a polite person. Her goal is to improve her business, build a house, and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, oil and sardines

loans.name: God Knows Us Group

texts.en:
Decontee E., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'God Knows Us'. Decontee is 24 years old, single, and has two children, 5 and 9 years old. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support. For 9 years, she has been operating a mini restaurant in Gbengba Town Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 6, 000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more meat, fish, cooking oil, onions, salt, etc.

She describes herself as an easy-going person. Her goal is to improve her business and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more meat, fish, cooking oil, onions, salt, etc.

loans.name: Sop

texts.en:
Sop L. has a recycling business and earns an average of US$ 3 each day to help cover her family’s living expenses. She is 46 years old, married and blessed with two teenage children. One of her daughters helps support the family by selling cakes. 

Sop L. is married to Sman Yass, 50 years of age, who earns a living selling ice-cream to school kids. Sop L. buys used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other countries. As her recycling business is very profitable, Sop L. hopes to sustain its growth through using the loan she has requested.

loans.use: To sustain her recycling business's growth

loans.name: Auntie Emma

texts.en: Auntie Emma K. is married and has two children. She is into the sale of slippers, going from place to place at Elmina. Auntie Emma has received senior high education. Her husband is a prison officer.  Auntie Emma uses her income in support of her children’s welfare. Auntie Emma will use the loan to purchase other varieties of slippers for sale. With the new revenue that is going to accrue from her business, she plans to plough back into her business.

loans.use: purchase other varieties of slippers for sale

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua A. sells groceries at Elmina. She is married to a security man and they live together with their two children. Efua has no educational background. She helps her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Efua will use the loan to purchase more groceries for sale. With the new earnings from her extended business, Efua plans to save towards the further studies of her children.

loans.use: purchase more groceries for sale

loans.name: Adowa

texts.en: Adowa A. prepares 'Fante kenkey' (fermented maize dough balls) for sale as well as selling raw corn at Elmina. Adowa has not received any form of education. She is divorced and has five dependents. Adowa has been selling 'Fante kenkey' for twenty years now. She is responsible for her dependents' well-being. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare 'kenkey' for distribution. She wishes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: buy more maize to prepare 'kenkey' for distribution

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba T. is married and has five dependents. She has not received any form of education.  Aba sells foodstuffs at Elmina. Her husband is a security man.  Aba uses her earnings from her sales to help her husband take care of her children. Aba will use the loan to purchase additional foodstuffs to resell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: purchase additional foodstuffs to resell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua A. is married and has two children. She has been through senior high school. Efua sells smoked (processed) fish at Elmina. Her husband is a security man. Efua uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke (process) for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: purchase more fresh fish to smoke (process) for sale

loans.name: Our God Is Able. Group

texts.en:
Angeline T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Our God Is Able. Angeline is 35 years old, married, and has five children aged from 5 to 19 years old. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support.
For the last two years, Angeline has been selling peanuts in Devine's Town Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of peanuts. Angeline describes herself as an earnest woman. Her goals are to improve her business, build a house, and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of peanuts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, cooking oil, onions, peppers, and beans

loans.name: Faith Association Group

texts.en:
Hajii J., is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'Faith Association'. Hajii is 29 years old, married, and has five children who range from 4 to 13 years old. She was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support. For 3 years, she has been selling used clothes in Matadi Estate,  on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of used clothes. She describes herself as a serviceable woman. Her dream is to expand her business and continue to educate her children so that they can have a better future. In the photo that accompanies this profile,Borbor D. is holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of toothpaste and baby soap

loans.name: Hawa Gull Group.

texts.en:
Hawa G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'Hawa G. Group'. She is 48 years old, married, and has three children who range from 16 to 20 years old. She was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support. For more than 18 years, she has been selling rice, onions, peppers, palm oil, and beans in Joe Bar Market, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 20,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 66,250 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of  rice, onions, peppers, palm oil, and beans. She describes herself as a devoted and serviceable woman. Her goal is to improve her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of  rice, onions, peppers, palm oil, and beans

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John S. is 40 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda.  He is married and has 3 children who are in school.  John has a general store, which he has run for 3 years.  

To help expand his business, John is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to increase shop inventory.  John hopes that the loan will help him by allowing him to expand the retail shop and get more sales.  In the future, John hopes to open other branches of the retail shop.

loans.use: to increase the retail shop's inventory

loans.name: Akossiwa Epse Egban

texts.en: Madame Akossiwa Epse Egban A. is 55 years old and lives in Lome, Togo. Madame A. has been selling maize since 1983. Today she sells her products at the Akodessewa Market in Lome. Madame A. is married to a mechanic and they have 4 children. She is requesting her first loan from WAGES of 200,000 CFA in order to purchase more sacks of maize that she will sell retail to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.en: Monsieur Kokouvi B. is a nurse in Lomé, Togo. He is 43 years old and has a small medical practice called "Le Diagnostic". He has had this practice since 1999 and is looking to expand. He would like to purchase different kinds of medical equipment and some medical products in order to offer better service to his clients. For this reason, Monsieur B. has requested a loan of 500,000 XOF in order to purchase these items and invest in his practice. Kokouvi is married to a hairdresser and they have two children.

loans.use: To purchase medical equipment and other items

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of palm oil

loans.name: God’S Vision Group

texts.en:
Jimmy Y., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God’s Vision. He is 34 years old, married, and has three children aged between 4 and 12 years old. He was only able to attend school through 9th grade due to lack of financial support. Jimmy cares for two siblings.
For the past ten years, Jimmy has been selling used shoes on Mechlin Street in Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of used shoes. Jimmy describes himself as a hardworking person. His goal is to expand his business and continue to educate his children so that they have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more bags of used shoes

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark is married to a trained and qualified nurse and they have five dependents, including their two children. Both children are in a private school. His wife assists him greatly in the pharmacy when she is off work.

Mark has a pharmacy in Messima Section, Bo. His pharmacy sells medicines retail and serves many families in the Messima community.

Mark has a good loan repayment history. He needs a loan of Le 3,000,000 to help him buy various pharmaceutical drugs in large quantities so that he can satisfy the needs of his numerous customers and make more profit.

Mark intends to use the proceeds from this loan to construct a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy various pharmaceutical drugs in large quantities

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 25 years old. He sells airtime scratch cards for different telecommunications companies in Naivasha town. He has been in this business for two years now.
Henry was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy more scratch cards for resale as they are in very high demand. In the future, Henry plans to open a shop from which to sell the scratch cards instead of hawking.

loans.use: To purchase airtime scratch cards for resale

loans.name: In Jesus Name. Group

texts.en:
Roseline N., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'In Jesus Name'. Roseline is 39 years old, married, and has five children who range from 2 to 19 years old. She was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support. For 2 years, she has been selling charcoal in Thinkers Village Market, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of charcoal. She describes herself as a serviceable woman.

Her dream is to expand her business, and continue to educate her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To  buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Pask

texts.en: Pask N. is currently in the business of selling charcoal out of her home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Pask is 53 years old and is widowed.   She has 6 children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to send three of her children to school.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jesus Esta Aqui 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Isabel is the coordinator of her group 'Jesus Esta Aqui' 1 & 2 (Jesus is here). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and 3 children and 3 nephews. She says that her most difficult challenges are raise her children and her nephews because after Haiti's earthquake, she needs to take care of them, because they were homeless and had lost family there.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying eating and watching television.

Isabel is excited to be taking her 5th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for over 4 and a half years, starting with her first loan, with which she bought a stove and gas tank to fry food. She plans to use this loan to invest in her businesses, She sells fried food in her fried food stand and she wants to use this loan to buy big bags or packets of wallets and shoes. She will use the profits to buy school supplies, shoes, and give better food to her big family, She wants to buy a home and have all her family together in a better house.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because she need a loan to start a business and the Esperanza program went to her community. Her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and unreliable electricity.

loans.use: to buy meat, plantain, potatoes, chicken, flour, oil, etc

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary D. is currently in the business of selling various hair-weaving materials at a beauty salon shop and is requesting a loan to stock more weaving materials and perfumes to sell.  Mary is 27 years old and is married to a husband who is a clerk. She has 2 children and only one of them goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a car for hire.

loans.use: Stock more hair-weaving materials and perfumes to sell

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana D. was born in Belovodskoe village (near the capital of Kyrgyzstan), where she still lives. She is 63 years old.  Tatyana was born in a low-income family and from early childhood, she had to help her parents around the house. 

Tatyana got married at the age of 23. Soon she gave birth to two daughters and one son. Her husband served as an inspector in a juvenile colony, and Tatyana got a job as a cleaner in a local school. Their salaries didn’t cover all expenses of the household. In order to support her family, Tatyana decided to start animal breeding. Using the small amount of 1,000 Kyrgyz Soms, she bought goats and rabbits. Later on, her livestock grew and she got milk cows, whose milk she sold to a dairy factory.

In 1998, Tatyana divorced her husband and became the only breadwinner for her children. During the next five years, Tatyana married her daughters off. In 2006, Tatyana’s son got married; at the same time her grandson was born, which further raised the family’s expenditures. Because of this, Tatyana had to sell most of her cattle. Today she has only 20 rabbits at her farm.

Now Tatyana is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kyrgyz Soms to buy ten pigs and one bull. That will allow her to further develop her household and business. 
In future, Tatyana plans to help her son buy a house. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Pasankeri, es soltera estudia administración de empresas actualmente trabaja elaborando la contabilidad de algunas tiendas y negocios, con esta actividad ella genera sus ingresos para subsistir; el crédito que solicita es para pagar el costo del tutor para ingreso a defensa de grado.

Esta es la primera vez que solicita crédito de impro y es primera vez que forma parte de Kiva.
texts.en:
Cristina lives in her parents' home in Pasankeri. She's single and studying business management, and earns a basic living doing the books for several stores and businesses. She's requesting a loan to pay for a tutor to help with her thesis. This is the first time she has sought a loan through Impro and also the first time with Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for a tutor for help with her University thesis

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier vive en la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltero y esta estudiando mecánica, trabaja en un taller de electricidad en la zona de tembladerani; el crédito que solicita es para comprar herramientas de trabajo y poder realizar servicios a domicilio, no es cliente de Impro y es primera vez que forma parte de Kiva,.

Por el carácter social puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Javier lives in the Tacagua area of La Paz. He is single and studying to be a mechanic. He works in an electrical workshop in the Tembladerani area. He's requesting a loan to buy work tools to be able to do house calls. He's not an Impro client and it's his first time with Kiva. His social status gives him access to a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase electrician's tools for house calls

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia vive en alquiler en la zona de pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casada tiene 5 hijos tres están casados y vive con sus dos hijos de 17 y 11 años de edad, el esposo trabaja en transporte pesado viajando tres veces por semana; ella tiene su casita en el campo donde cría vacas, la actividad que tiene para generar su ingresos es la venta de leche, por primera vez es cliente de Impro y también de kiva.
El crédito que solicita es para la compra de alimento para su ganado.
Por el carácter social puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Julia rents a place in the Pasankeri zone of the city of La Paz. She is married and has 5 children, 3 of whom are married. She lives with her two children aged 17 and 11. Her husband works in transport, traveling three times per week. Her small home is in the field where she raises cows; she sells milk to generate her income. She is a new client of Impro and of Kiva. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of food for her livestock. She qualifies for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of food for her dairy cows

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
El señor Gonzalo vive en casa propia en la zona las lomas de la ciudad de la paz, esta casado tiene tres hijos de 18,14 y 12 años de edad, trabaja fabricando botas para damas en su taller que esta dentro del domicilio, la esposa trabaja como empleada en una galería de ropa. Con este crédito ya son dos veces que es cliente de Impro y por primera vez de Kiva. El crédito lo destinará a la compra de cuero, cola, tacos de goma, etc., para su negocio de zapateria.

Por el carácter social puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Gonzalo lives in his own home in the Las Lomas zone of the city of La Paz. He is married and has three children ages 18, 14 and 12. He works making boots for women in his workshop which is in his home. His wife works as an employee at a clothing store. This is his second loan with Impro and the first through Kiva. He will use this loan for the purchase of leather, glue, rubber heels, etc., for his shoe business. Due to his social character, he qualifies for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: leather, glue, rubber heels, etc., for his shoe store

loans.name: Adjo Délali

texts.en: Madame Adjo Délali A. is a 25-year-old married woman who works selling men's dress shirts and sheets in Lomé, Togo. She does not have a set location where she sells her products – mostly she carries them with her and sells them as she walks through her neighborhood. Adjo used to work as a secretary but in 2009 she took on this commercial activity as jobs were hard to find and her income was insufficient. She is now taking her second loan from Kiva partner, WAGES, of 300,000 XOF in order to purchase more sheets and dress shirts to sell.

loans.use: To purchase men's shirts and sheets

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Verónica vive en casa propia en la zona de san Martín de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casada tiene tres hijos de 14,12 y 10 años de edad; el esposo trabaja como albañil, ella vende papa para ayudar a su hogar, no es cliente de impro y es primera vez que es cliente de Kiva.
El crédito es para compra de papa al por mayor de los productores para su venta posterior al consumidor.

Por el carácter social puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs Verónica lives in her own home in the San Martin zone of the city of La Paz. She is married and has three children ages 14, 12 and 10. Her husband works as a bricklayer and she sells potatoes to help out. She is not a customer of Impro and this is her first loan with Kiva. This loan is for the purchase of potatoes at wholesale prices from the producers for her to later sell to customers. Due to her social character she can access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: wholesale purchase of potatoes for sale to customers

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es: Carlos José tiene 50 años. Pues tiene mucho tiempo de ser cliente de Fundación y con la ayuda de los financiamientos ha podido sacar adelante su actividad.  El es un hombre responsable  Carlos tiene 4 hijos 2 de ellos son menores de edad y están a su cargo, el les proporciona los estudios y alimentos necesarios. Desde muy Joven tuvo que trabajar para sacar a su familia adelante su actividad es la venta de materiales de ferretería, hace más de 7 años que trabaja fuertemente, por lo que sus inicios fueron con fondos propios, por lo que siempre tiene clientes que le solicitan diferentes productos. El destino del crédito será para la compra de escuadras, llaves, cerraduras, candados y lámparas.
texts.en:
Carlos José is 50. He has been a client of Fundacion for a long time, and with the help of the loans he has been able to get ahead with his business. He is a responsible man. He has 4 children, 2 of whom are young and under his care. He provides them with the necessary education and food. From his youth, Carlos has had to work to get his family ahead. He sells hardware materials. He has worked hard for more than 7 years. He began with his own funds, and he always has customers who request different products. The loan will be used for the purchase of set squares, keys, locks, padlocks and lamps.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Mademoiselle Ama A. is 36 years old and since 2007 has been selling motor oil in Lomé, Togo. Ama has one child to care for and the income she receives from selling motor oil allows her to care for her child. Normally she purchases her oil across the border in Ghana. She is now requesting her second loan from Kiva partner, WAGES, of 200,000 XOF in order to purchase more oil.

loans.use: To purchase motor oil

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria Teresa tiene 38 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que la mayoría de sus clientes asisten a su vivienda donde vende comestibles como arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, leche, gaseosas. Ella y su esposo tienen 2 hijos, pues trabaja los 7 días de la semana, desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Cierta cantidad de clientes vistan su tienda y el negocio se anima durante todos los días. Le gustaría emplear el dinero de este préstamo para en comprar más mercadería como arroz, fideos, huevos, leche, jugos, golosinas entre otras cosas. Maria es una mujer emprendedora, responsable y puntual.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa is 38. She has had a general store for more than 4 years. The majority of her customers go to her home where she sells food items such as rice, sugar, noodles, oil, milk, and pop. She and her husband have 2 children. She works 7 days a week, from 5 am to 7 pm. A certain number of customers go to her store and brighten up the business every day. Maria would like to use the money from this loan to purchase more merchandise such as rice, noodles, eggs, milk, juice, and candies among other items. Maria is an enterprising, responsible and punctual woman.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Umoja Development Group-Jinja

texts.en: Three years ago, 44-year-old O. Francis made a solemn pledge to begin and carefully oversee a poultry-selling business in Walukuba-Jinja. Being the astute gentleman that he is, he has made great strides with his business. He is proud of the decision he took and it shows with the smiles he flashes when we approach him. In a week, this happily married father of four, makes profit returns that are to the tune of 50,000 UGX.
