This is relatively minimal considering how fried and roast chicken is in high demand across the country, especially in the urban areas. It is a business this progressive-thinking man began one Christmas season with savings from his now defunct alcohol-selling enterprise. Francis is employed in a maize-milling company around Jinja. With this loan, he wants to purchase more poultry for resale. He says this will help him make more sales revenue.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry for resale

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. is divorced and has seven dependents. She has received junior high education.

Ama fries fresh fish for sale at Elmina which she has been doing for twenty years. She distributes her fried fish to kenkey sellers in her locality and uses her income in taking care of her children. Kenkey is fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves and often served with fish.

Ama will add the loan she hopes to get, to her original capital to purchase more fresh fish to fry. She plans on reinvesting in her business the profit she anticipates getting.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish to fry and sell

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Roberto Antonio C. C., tiene la edad de 47 años vive en el barrio La Borgoña y su esposa se dedica a realzar los trabajos del hogar y le apoya en las labores del campo, él es agricultor desde hace 21 años y su actividad ha sido el sustento económico de toda su familia, ellos tienen 4 hijos de los cuales 2 son mayores de edad y dos adolecentes que así mismo le ayudan en las tareas de la finca.

La afectación de las plagas no ha permitido en este año una buena cosecha, esto ha afectado su economía doméstica, y es por esta razón que solicitan un préstamo para dar un mejor mantenimiento a los sembradillos y que la producción aumenté presentándole a futuro un mejor volúmenes en las ventas con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad de vida y ofrecerle a su familia mejores condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Roberto Antonio C. C. is 47 and lives in the La Borgoña neighbourhood. His wife does the housework and helps him with work in the field. He has been a farmer for 21 years, and this has been the source of income for his whole family. They have 4 children, of whom 2 are grown and two are adolescents who also help with the farm work. Plagues prevented a good harvest this year, and this has affected the family's finances. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to provide better maintenance to his plants, so that production will increase, providing him with greater sales volume in the future. His goal is to improve their quality of life and offer his family better economic conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: better crop maintenance

loans.name: Modoukpe

texts.en:
Madame Modoukpe A. is 26 years old and lives in her hometown of Lomé, Togo. She is married and has one child.
Modoukpe sells cosmetics in her neighborhood in Lomé. She has been selling these products since 2005. Modoukpe has requested her first loan from Kiva partner, WAGES, of 180,000 XOF in order to purchase more products to sell. With this loan she will invest more into her business, hopefully increasing her profits and providing a better life for her family.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: Celsa

texts.es: Celsa tiene 24 años, vive con su pareja en casa de sus familiares. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la fabricación de tubos curvos y de conexión que sirven para las instalaciones eléctricas y para el servicio de agua. Su pequeña fábrica esta en el segundo piso de la casa donde vive y cuenta con la ayuda de 2 primos. Su trabajo consiste en abastecerse de tubos planos de diferentes medidas de espesor, en el que luego son cortadas y moldeadas, entonces lo que produce lo reparte a las diferentes  ferreterías, y con ayuda de su pareja terminar de distribuir su mercadería a los diversos puntos de venta. Este negocio le ha resultado ser muy rentable y afirma que a pesar del riesgo que ha tenido continua trabajando en su actividad. En adelante desea mejorar su fábrica. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más tubos de distintas medidas a fin de abastecerse de suficiente material.
texts.en:
Celsa is 24 and lives with her partner in the home of family members. For 3 years she has made curved tubes used to connect electrical and water services. Her small factory is on the second floor of the home where she lives, and she is helped by 2 cousins. Her work consists of supplying herself with flat tubes of different thicknesses, which are then cut and shaped. They distribute this product to various hardware stores, and with her partner's help they distribute to diverse areas. This business has proved very profitable, and Celsa says that despite the risk, she has continued to do this activity. She now wants to improve her factory. This is her first loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support, and she is grateful to be part of her community bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive. She thanks those people who will support this loan. It will be very useful for the advancement of her business. With the loan that she is requesting, she will invest in the purchase of more tubes of various measurements, in order to supply herself with enough materials.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of tubes of various sizes

loans.name: Silvia Jaqueline

texts.es:
Silvia Jaqueline A. V. tiene 38 anos. Vive soltera en el canton de Chillanes en la província de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos de 15 y 8 anos. 

Silvia es una socia de la ventanilla rural Genesis, que esta ubicada casi 2 horas de Chillanes. Son 11 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dideican al cultivo de maiz, arroz, soya, platano, papaya, y otros. 

Silvia se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maiz y soya en el verano y al cultivo de arroz en el invierno. Realiza sus compras y sus ventas en Mata de Cacao cada 2 semanas. 

Solicita el prestamo para sembrar maiz y cacao, que con el prestamo cambiaria su situación economico poco a poco. Su sueno es que sus hijos tengan un futuro en la educación. Es el mejor que Silvia puede dejar a ellos. 

Le gusta practicar deportes, especialmente el indor futbol.
texts.en:
Silvia Jaqueline A. V. is 38. She is single and lives in the Chillanes canton in the province of Bolivar. She has 2 children ages 15 and 8. Silvia is a member of the rural Genesis community bank, which is located almost 2 hours from Chillanes. There are 11 members in total, the majority of whom cultivate corn, rice, soy, plantains, potatoes, and other items. Silvia is a farmer. She grows corn and soy in the summer and rice in the winter. She makes her purchases and sales in Mata de Cacao every 2 weeks. She is requesting this loan to sow corn and cocoa. With this loan she will change her economic situation little by little. Her dream is for her children to have a future in education. This is the best that Silvia can leave them. She enjoys playing sports, especially indoor soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: corn crops

loans.name: K. Djimido

texts.en: Djimido A. is 26 years old and lives in Lomé, Togo, where he works as a welder. His garage is located in the Akodessewa region of Lomé, and is called "Fafa Neva". Djimido has been in business since 2005. This is his first loan from Kiva partner, WAGES. He has requested 150,000 XOF in order to purchase gas and other supplies he uses to do his vehicle repairs.

loans.use: To purchase gas and supplies

loans.name: Ana Eylen

texts.es:
Ana Eylen G. V. tiene 37 anos. Vive soltera en el canton de Chillanes en la província de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hija de 2 meses. 

Ana es un socio de la ventanilla rural Genesis, que esta ubicada casi 2 horas de Chillanes. Son 11 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dideican al cultivo de maiz, arroz, soya, platano, papaya, y otros.

Ana se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de soya y maiz en el verano y al cultivo de arroz en el verano. Cultiva el cacao todo el ano. Realiza sus compras y sus ventas en Mata de Cacao 1 vez por semana. 

Solicita el prestamo para sembrar soya y maiz, que con la ayuda del credito se va a crecer sus cultivos y mejorar su familia. Su sueno es incrementar su negocio poco a poco. 

Le gusta bailar, especialmente a la musica merengue, la salsa, y a la musica nacional.
texts.en:
Ana Eylen G. V. is 37. She is single and lives in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolivar. She has one daughter who is 2 months old. Ana is a member of the rural Genesis community bank, which is located almost 2 hours from Chillanes. There are 11 members in total, the majority of whom cultivate corn, rice, soy, plantains, papaya and other items. Ana is a farmer. She grows soy and corn in the summer and rice in the winter. She grows cocoa all year round. She makes her purchases and sales in Mata de Cacao once a week. She is requesting this loan for sowing soy and corn. With the help of this credit she will grow her crops and improve her family's lives. Her dream is to increase her business bit by bit. She enjoys dancing, especially merengue, salsa and national music.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: soy and corn crops

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cosmetics.

loans.name: Unity Is Strength. Group

texts.en:
Samuel S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Unity Is Strength. Samuel is 29 years old, married and has one child who is 4 years old.  He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial difficulty. He cares for two siblings. 

For 6 years, he has been selling jeans, trousers and skirts for gents and ladies in the Redlight Market, in Paynesville outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more jeans trousers and skirts for gents and ladies.

Samuel describes himself as a quiet person. His dream is to improve his business to a point where he will be able to order goods from abroad.

 In the photo that accompanies this profile, Andrew is inset at the lower right because he was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more jeans trousers and skirts for gents and ladies.

loans.name: Danelia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Danelia del Carmen R. C., es un adulto mayor vive en el Barrio Medardo Andino es casada y su esposo trabaja como guarda de seguridad, tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad, que habitan en sus propias casas y laboran en empresas privadas, ellos tiene un miscelánea, la cual representa el ingreso fuerte de la familia, gracias a su trabajo diario su negocio ha tenido buena acogida entre la población y el surtido de la mercadería ha ido en crecimiento, es para su pulpería que solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de granos básicos que sigan contribuyendo a este desarrollo que contribuye al bienestar económico de toda la familia, sobretodo el de los señores ya que pronto el esposo se jubilara y su negocio será su fuente de ingreso principal de los dos.
texts.en:
Miss Danelia del Carmen R. C. is an adult. She lives in the Medardo Andino neighbourhood and is married. Her husband works as a security guard. They have 3 grown children, who live in their own homes and work for private companies. She and her husband have a small general store, which provides their income. Thanks to her daily work, her business has become well known among the people and her stock of merchandise has been growing. She is requesting this loan for her store, to invest it in the purchase of basic grains which will contribute to the development of the store, which contributes to the economic well-being of all of the family. Above all this is important for the couple, since her husband will soon retire and the store will be the main source of income for them both.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Meyevi

texts.en:
Madame Meyevi H. is 37 years old and lives in her hometown of Lome, Togo. She is married to a policeman.

Meyevi is a seamstress and has had her own shop, called Juliene Couture, since 2003. She also has two employees who work for her.

Meyevi would like to expand her business and to this end she has taken a loan of 350,000 CFA in order to purchase different kinds of fabrics that she uses to make her dresses. Offering different kinds of fabrics will satisfy her existing customers better and hopefully attract new ones.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and other supplies

loans.name: Lerida Mercedes

texts.es:
Lerida Mercedes G. V. tiene 50 anos. Vive soltera en el canton de Chillanes en la província de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijo de 27 anos. 

Lerida es una socia de la ventanilla rural Genesis, que esta ubicada casi 2 horas de Chillanes. Son 11 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dideican al cultivo de maiz, arroz, soya, platano, papaya, y otros.

Lerida se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maiz y cacao. Realiza las compras y las ventas de sus productos en Mata de Cacao 2 veces por semana. 

Solicita el credito para comprar semillas para su agricultura. Con el apoyo del prestamo se va a poder sembrar mas maiz y mejorar su agricultura. Su sueno es adelantar con su agricultura. 

En su tiempo libre, le gusta hacer cosas en la casa y escuchar musica nacional.
texts.en:
Lerida is 50 years old and lives by herself in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolívar. She has 1 son who is 27. She is a member of the Genesis rural bank, located almost 2 hours from Chillanes. There are 11 members in total, who in the majority cultivate corn, rice, soy, plantains, papaya, and other crops. Lerida dedicates herself to agriculture, cultivating corn and cacao. She buys what she needs and sells her harvests in Mata de Cacao twice a week. Lerida requests a loan to buy seeds to sow. With the help of this loan, she will be able to sow more corn and improve her agriculture. Her dream is to advance her farming. In her free time, she likes to make things at home and to listen to Ecuadorian music.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING SEED CORN TO SOW AND IMPROVE HER CROP

loans.name: Nisson Ney

texts.es:
Nisson Ney G. V. tiene 40 anos. Es casado y vive en el canton de Chillanes en la província de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos de 9, 7, y 5 anos. 

Nisson es una socia de la ventanilla rural Genesis, que esta ubicada casi 2 horas de Chillanes. Son 11 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maiz, arroz, soya, platano, papaya, y otros.

Nisson se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maiz. La semilla compra en Mata de Cacao para la cosecha. Compra sus abonos al mes. 

Solicita el credito para crecer mas maiz. Con la producion del maiz va a mejorar su situación economico. Su sueno es seguir superando. 

Trabaja todo el mes, pero le gusta jugar a veces el futbol.
texts.en:
Nisson Ney G. V. is 40 years old, is married, and lives in the Chillanes hamlet within the Bolívar province. He has three children, ages 9, 7, and 5. Nisson is part of the “Ventanilla Rural Genesis” group, located nearly two hours from Chillanes. There are 11 members in total, most of whom raise corn, rice, soy, bananas, papaya, and other things. Nisson raises corn. He buys his seeds in Mata de Cacao and buys fertilizer once a month. He is asking for this loan in order to grow more corn. His economic situation will improve with his production. He wants to continue to get ahead. He works the entire month, but sometimes likes to play soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Corn seed

loans.name: Camino De Victoria 3 Group

texts.en:
Luisa is the coordinator of her group, Camino D. Victoria 3 (Road to victory). She makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children. She says that her most difficult challenges are to build her house and to give a better life to her family. In the meantime, she plans to continue to enjoy cooking.

Luisa is excited to be taking her first loan, with which she will start her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying miscellaneous products, especially clothing and underwear. She will use the profits to buy school supplies for her children and to invest more in her business.

Luisa is dreaming of having her own home and, thanks to her business and to Esperanza loans, she wishes that her dream will become reality.

This associate began with Esperanza because she wanted to go forward with starting her business and be in a program like Esperanza offers. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Her group is located in Santiago, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic, and an area famous for its tobacco and beef production. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: To buy clothing and underwear to sell

loans.name: Youth For Progress Group

texts.en:
Pervis G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Youth For Progress. Pervis is 34 years old, is single, and has two children who are 8 and 17 years old. He is a senior student in college.

For three years, Pervis has been operating a foreign exchange bureau in Red Light Market, Paynesville,  outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

Pervis plans to use his 10,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 50,000 Liberian dollar group loan to add more money to his business.
Pervis describes himself as a polite man. His dream is to improve his business and continue to educate his children.

loans.use: To add more money to his business.

loans.name: Mariana Santos

texts.es:
Mariana Santos E. S. tiene 50 anos. Vive en union libre en el canton de Chillanes en la província de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos: 2 gemelas de 31 anos y una hija de 25 anos. 

Mariana es una socia de la ventanilla rural Genesis, que esta ubicada casi 2 horas de Chillanes. Son 11 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dideican al cultivo de maiz, arroz, soya, platano, papaya, y otros.

Mariana se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de soya, maiz, y frijol. Realiza sus compras y ventas de sus productos en Mata de Cacao a la semana. 

Solicita el credito para su agricultura. Lo va a invertir en sembrar mas maiz y frijol. Su sueno es sacar un negocio mas grande y seguir creciendo. 

En su tiempo libre hace cosas en la casa como cocinar, arreglar la casa, y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Mariana Santos E. S. is fifty years old and lives in the canton of Chillanes, in Bolívar province. She has three children: twins, a thirty-one year old, and a twenty-five year old daughter. Mariana is a member of the communal bank "Genesis," which is located two hours from Chillanes. There are eleven members in total, who for the most part, cultivate corn, rice, soy, plantains, papaya, and other crops for a living. Mariana is a farmer who cultivates soy, corn, and beans. She makes her purchases and sells her products in Mata de Cacao each week. She is taking out a loan for her farming and is going to invest it in planting more corn and beans. Her dream is to have a bigger business and to keep growing. She does house work like cooking, straightening up the house, and helping her family when she has free time.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in corn and beans to plant.

loans.name: New Foundation Business Group

texts.en:
T. H., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called New Foundation Business. T. is 46 years old and is married with four children who are between 11 and 20 years old. He also cares for one sibling. T. is a senior student in college. He lives in Montserrado County and is served at the Redlight branch of this MFI, (LEAP).

For seven years, T. has been operating a pharmacy in Jacob’s Town, Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 10,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 47,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more(drugs) medicines for his business.

T. describes himself as a kind and polite man. His dream is to improve his business and build a clinic.

loans.use: To buy more medicines for his business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Juana Piedad

texts.es:
Juana Piedad Z. N. tiene 53 anos. Vive en union libre en el canton de Chillanes en la província de Bolívar. Tiene 8 hijos. 

Juana es una socia de la ventanilla rural Genesis, que esta ubicada casi 2 horas de Chillanes. Son 11 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dideican al cultivo de maiz, arroz, soya, platano, papaya, y otros.

Juana se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maiz, arroz, y soya. Realiza sus compras y sus ventas en Mata de Cacao cada vez que necesita una cosa. 

Solicita el credito para sembrar mas maiz, que le va a dar mas ganancia. Su sueno es crecer mas con la finca y seguir trabajando. 

En su tiempo libre, le gusta jugar con sus nietos en el patio.
texts.en:
Juana Piedad Z. N. is fifty-three years old and lives with her partner in the canton of Chillanes, in Bolivar province. She has eight children. Juana is a member of the rural bank "Genesis," which is located about two hours from Chillanes. There are eleven members in the group who make a living, for the most part, growing corn, rice, soy, plantains, papaya, and other crops. Juana makes her purchases and sells her products in Mata de Cacao whenever she needs something. She is taking out a loan to plant more corn, which will provide her with more income. She dreams of growing her farm and continuing to work. In her spare time, she like to play with her grandchildren on the patio.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To plant corn.

loans.name: Saby

texts.es: Saby tiene 26 años, vive sola en una casa alquilada. Desde hace un año empezó a trabajar de manera independiente, por lo que ahora se dedica a vender frazadas, así como organizar eventos sociales. Su forma de trabajo, en este caso la ventas de sus artículos para la casa, lo realiza mediante catálogos, y la adquisición del producto lo comprar al por mayor para luego ser ofrecidos a crédito. Le gusta las actividades que realiza porque le permite ser independiente, aunque reconoce que  a veces las dificultades  de los pagos  impuntuales de sus clientes le han perjudicado, pero ha sabido superarlas con estrategia de cobranzas, es por eso que su gran sueño es  tener más capital  para  que sus negocios tengan mayor rentabilidad. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la implementación de ambos negocios.
texts.en:
Saby is 26 years old and lives alone in a rented house. She began working independently a year ago and now sells blankets and organizes social events. Particularly in the case of household items, she uses catalogues to buy her products in bulk and then later offers credit to her buyers to purchase them. She likes this kind of work beause it allows her to be independtent even though she knows that sometimes late payments from her clients cause difficulties for her. But she knows how to work around this challenge with her payment strategies. Her large dream is to have more capital so that her business become even more successful. This is her first loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial help. In addition, she appreciates being part of her village bank since all participants are responsible and united. She is thankful for the people that administer the loan she requested. It will be important in her business' progress. With this loan she will expand both businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more blankets and other household items

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Maria Teresa S. R., tiene la edad de 36 años es casada y su esposo trabaja como albañil, ellos son una familia muy humilde, que cuenta son los ingresos de su esposo para sobrellevar los gastos mensuales, ella es nutricionista y con su esfuerzo propio y el de su esposo han comprado productos que tienen una buena demanda entre la población, y le generan ingresos extras a su familia, ellos tienen 5 hijos varones que estudian y algunos trabajan y apoyan económicamente a sus padres.

Es para su negocio, que solicita un préstamo para la compra de un mayor inventario de productos de nutrición, debido a que es mercadería de precios elevados, pero su clientela tiene un nivel económico alto y goza de bastante aceptación entre ese mercado, espera que una mayor inversión le traerá mejores ingresos que favorecerá al bienestar económico de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa S. R. is 36 years old and married. Her husband works as a mason. They are a very humble family who depend on her husband's income to cover their monthly expenses. She is a nutritionist, and with her own effort and that of her husband, she has been able to buy products that are in great demand among the population, and these generate extra income for the family. They have 5 sons who are in school, with some of them working and economically helping their parents. Maria Teresa is requesting a loan for her business, to buy a larger inventory of nutrition products, since this is an expensive type of merchandise. However, her customers have a high income level, and she is well-liked within this market. She hopes that a larger investment will bring her more income, which will improve her family's economic well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying nutrition products to sell

loans.name: Silvio Raimundo

texts.es:
Silvio Raimundo A. V. tiene 63 anos. Vive soltero en el canton de Chillanes en la província de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos de 41 y 38 anos. 

Silvio es socio de la ventanilla rural Genesis, que esta ubicada casi 2 horas de Chillanes. Son 11 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dideican al cultivo de maiz, arroz, soya, platano, papaya, y otros.

Silvio se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maiz, arroz, y cacao. Realiza las compras y las ventas de sus productos en Mata de Cacao cada 8 dias. 

Solicita el credito para sembrar mas maiz, que con el apoyo del credito se va a mejorar su vida. Su sueno es tener una casa propoa. 

Le gusta pasear y pasar tiempo en la casa en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Silvio Raimundo A. V. is 63 years old. He lives alone in the Chillanes district in Bolivar province. He has two children, who are 41 and 38. Silvio is a member of the Genesis community bank, which is located almost 2 hours from Chillanes. There are 11 members in all, the majority of whom raise corn, rice, soy beans, bananas, papayas, and other crops. Silvio works in agriculture, cultivating corn, rice, and cocoa. He makes purchases and sells his products in Mata de Cacao every eight days. He is applying for the loan to plant more corn, which, with the help of the loan, will improve his life. His dream is to have his own house. In his free time, he likes to go for walks and spend time in his house.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: plant corn

loans.name: Fe Y Amor 4 Group

texts.en:
Carmen is the coordinator of her group Fe y Amor 4 (Faith and Love). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children. She says that her most difficult challenges are to improve her business and work hard to pay this and another loan she will need for her improvement. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to cook.

Carmen is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for over a year, starting with her first loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her hot-dog selling business by buying bread, sausage, cabbage, ketchup, mayonnaise and other items. She will use the profits to buy school supplies for her children and to build part of her house and she want to have a better business and go forward.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she likes the facilities Esperanza offers to its clients. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti, generally. Her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production that is the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy bread, sausage, cabbage, ketchup, mayonnaise and other items

loans.name: Claudia Janeth

texts.es: Claudia Janeth tiene 42 años, su actividad económica es la venta de ropa y semilla de jícaro. Hace más de 13 años que se dedica a esta medio de vida, pues siempre está pensando en lo que su familia necesita, ella tiene 1 hijo de 7 años a su cargo por lo que su esposo no tenía un trabajo estable fue así que ella deicidio sacar adelante a su familia, a pesar de las diferentes dificultades que atraviesa por lo que tiene que recorrer distancias muy lejanas para ofrecer sus productos a diferentes clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima necesaria para aumentar su inventario.
texts.en:
Claudia Janeth is forty-two years old and sells clothing and jicaro (gourd) seeds for a living. She has made her living this way for more than thirteen years, since she is always thinking about what her family needs. She has a seven-year old son to support. Her husband did not have stable work, so she decided to help her family get by in spite of the difficulties she faces like traveling long distances to sell her products to her customers. The loan she is taking out is to buy raw materials needed to increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Leonso Euclides

texts.es:
Leonso Euclides G. V. tiene 43 anos. Vive soltero en el canton de Chillanes en la província de Bolívar. Tiene 1 hijo de 8 anos. 

Leonso es un socio de la ventanilla rural Genesis, que esta ubicada casi 2 horas de Chillanes. Son 11 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dideican al cultivo de maiz, arroz, soya, platano, papaya, y otros.

Leonso se dedica a la agricultrura y tambien es comerciante de madera. Realiza las compras y las ventas de sus productos en Mata de Cacao y en Babahoyo 3 veces al mes. 

Solicita el credito para crecer su negocio mas. Con el apoyo del credito poco a poco se va aumentando. Su sueno es darle mejor vida a su hijo. 

Le gusta jugar el futbol.
texts.en:
Leonso Euclides G. V. is 43 years old. He live alone in the canton of Chillanes, in Bolivar Province. He has one son who is 8 years old. Leonso is a member of the rural solidarity group "Genesis," which is located two hours from Chillanes. There are 11 members in all, most of whom farm corn, rice, soy, bananas, papaya, and other crops. Leonso works in agriculture and also deals in wood. He purchases and sells his products 3 times per month in Mata de Cacao and Babahoyo. He is requesting this loan to grow his business more. With the support of this loan, little by little he is growing. His dream is to give his son a better life. He likes to play soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to build his agriculture business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Divine Favor. Group

texts.en:
Yassah G., shown holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Divine Favor.  Yassah is 35 years old, single and has three children who range from 4 to 17 years old. She was only able to attend school through 11th grade due to lack of financial support. She also cares for two siblings.

For six years, Yassah has been operating a beauty salon in Redlight, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.  A hard-working person, she plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more hair braiding materials including hair drier, perm, gel, shampoo, etc.

Yassah's dream is to improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more hair braiding materials such as hair drier, perm, gel, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Yudith

texts.es: Yudith tiene 27 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en una casa que le fue heredada por su suegra. Desde hace 5 meses vende comida, y con la ayuda de sus 2 hijos mayores, puede atender a la clientela que acude en su pequeño establecimiento. Siendo este puesto habilitado con un triciclo como base, y del que se encuentra instalado en la puerta de su casa, asimismo tiene mesas y sillas para la comodidad de sus clientes. Una de sus  estrategias para atraer a sus comensales es el televisor que tiene, por lo que garantiza el retorno de sus consumidores. Afirma que le gusta trabajar porque se genera sus propios recursos, ya así puede dar bienestar a sus hijos, además que siempre ha sido una gran salida para afrontar momentos difíciles en la economía. Considera que este negocio es rentable porque  no requiere de mucha inversión y le da rentas que puede  cubrir sus gastos por lo que su deseo es mejorar su negocio con mejores instalaciones en su propio local. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra mercadería como gaseosa y dulces para que tenga mayores opciones de ventas.
texts.en:
Yudith is 27 years old and lives with her husband and her three children in a house that they inherited from her mother-in-law. She has been selling food for five months and with the help of her two oldest children she is able to serve the clients that come to her small establishment. She sells food from a stall at the door of her home where she has tables and chairs for the comfort of her clients. One of her strategies to attract diners is the television that she has which guarantees that consumers will return. She says she likes to work because she generates her own income and can provide for the well being of her children and it is a great way to face difficult economic times. Yudith believes this business is profitable because it does not require much investment and gives her the income to cover her expenses so her desire is to improve this business with better facilities. This is the first loan with field partner MFP. She is happy to know that she has financial support. She is also happy to be part of a community bank because all of its members are responsible people and very supportive. Yudith is grateful to all those people who will be managing the loan which will be very helpful in the progress of her business. She will invest the loan she is requesting on the purchase of merchandise such as soft drinks and candies so that she can provide more options to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks and candies.

loans.name: Pablo Santiago

texts.es:
Pablo Santiago J. P. tiene 32 anos. Vive soltero en el canton de Chillanes en la província de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 11 anos. 

Pablo es un socio de la ventanilla rural Genesis, que esta ubicada casi 2 horas de Chillanes. Son 11 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz, arroz, soya, plátano, papaya, y otros.

Pablo se dedica a la agricultura. Tiene cultivos de maíz, cacao, café, plátano, y papaya. Realiza las compras y las ventas de sus productos en Mata de Cacao una vez por cosecha. 

Solicita el credito para invertir en la agricultura, para comprar maiz, y para comprar mas o menos 3 chanchos. El apoyo de este prestamo le daria éxito en su negocio y permitirlo seguir adelante. Su sueno es darles educación a sus hijos para que tengan éxito, y tambien que duplica su negocio. Un desafio que le ha enfrentado es que el precio de la venta del producto de maiz ha bajado. Espero que no baja el precio para la cosecha que viene. 

Le gusta pasar tiempo dando vueltas por la finca, mirando como estan las plantas.
texts.en:
Pablo Santiago J. P. is 32 years old. He is not married and lives in the canton of Chillanes in Bolívar province. He has 2 children who are 13 and 11 years old. Pablo is a member of the “Genesis” communal bank, which is located almost two hours from Chillanes. There are 11 members in total, and the majority of them grow corn, rice, soy, cacao, coffee, plantains, papaya, and other crops. Pablo works in agriculture. He has corn, cacao, coffee, plantains, and papaya. He makes his purchases and sells his products in Mata de Cacao once per harvest. He is requesting the loan to invest in agriculture, to buy corn, and to buy approximately 3 pigs. The support of this loan would give him success in his business and allow him to get ahead. His dreams are to give an education to his children so they can be successful, and also to double his business. One challenge that he has confronted is that the price of corn has gone down. He hopes the price won’t go down again before the next harvest. He likes to pass his time walking around his farm, seeing how his plants are doing.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in agriculture and to plant corn

loans.name: Martana Ingrid

texts.es:
Martana Ingrid G. V. tiene 36 anos. Vive soltero en el canton de Chillanes en la província de Bolívar. No tiene hijos.  

Martana es una socia de la ventanilla rural Genesis, que esta ubicada casi 2 horas de Chillanes. Son 11 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz, arroz, soya, plátano, papaya, y otros.

Martana se dedica a la agricultura. Tiene cultivos de maíz, arroz, cacao, café, y soya. Vende sus productos en Mata de Cacao y va toda la semana para hacer compras y ventas. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos y insecticidas para las plagas. Con el apoyo de este prestamo se va a mejorar su vida y seguir incrementando. Su sueno es seguir adelante con su negocio. Tiene miedo de que si no sale bien, no se avanza. Si sale bien, se gana, dice Martana.  

En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer cosas en la casa.
texts.en:
Martana Ingrid G. V. is 36 years old. She is single and lives in the canton of Chillanes in Bolívar province. She doesn’t have children. Martana is a member of the “Genesis” communal bank, which is located almost 2 hours from Chillanes. There are 11 members in total, and the majority of them grow corn, rice, soy, plantains, papaya, and other crops. Martana works in agriculture. She has corn, rice, cacao, coffee, and soy. She sells her products in Mata de Cacao and she goes every week to make purchases and sales. She is requesting the loan to buy fertilizers and insecticides for pests. With the support of this loan she will improve her life and continue growing. Her dream is to continue with her business. She is afraid that if things don’t go well, she won’t make progress. If they do go well, she will earn, says Martana. In her free time she likes to do things around the house.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insecticides for agriculture

loans.name: Esperar En Dios Group

texts.es: Grupo originario de Sumpango, Sac., Doña Valentina se dedica a la agricultura un negocio que le ha sido rentable, ya que la tierra donde trabaja es muy fertil, Rosario hija de doña Valentina se dedica a vender panes en su casa, ella desea ampliar su venta y ofrecer otros productos básicos, La hija menor Hilda se dedica a tejer fajas tipícas, ellas han sido anteriormente clientas con FAPE y hoy agradecen a Kiva por ayudarles a cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
This group is from Sumpango, Sac. Ms. Valentina is a farmer, a business which has been profitable for her because the land that she works has been very fertile. Valentina's daughter, Rosario, sells bread from her home. She hopes to expand her sales and offer other basic commodities. Valentina's youngest daughter, Hilda, weaves traditional bands. They have previously been clients of field parnter FAPE and today are thankful to Kiva for helping them realize their dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in their businesses

loans.name: Reina Maria

texts.es: Reina María tiene 34 años. Su hijo estudia y ella se hace cargo de que el tenga lo mas necesario. Su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos, por lo que Reina tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación y con financiamientos, siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer responsable. Sus inicios debido a la difícil situación económica, ella tomo la iniciativa por cuenta propia y ofrecer sus productos por catálogos, así sus clientes escogen los diferentes productos. Este financiamiento es para comprar perfumes, tintes, pintura de uñas, cremas y polvos. Pues siempre sueña con tener un establecimiento propio.
texts.en:
Reina María is 34 years old. Her son is in school, and she makes sure that he has what he needs most. Her economic activity is selling cosmetics. Reina has worked with the Foundation and with loans for a long time, and she has always shown herself to be a responsible person. She started out due to a difficult economic situation; she took the initiative to start working for herself and offering products out of catalogs, so that her customers can choose from a range of products. This loan will be used to buy perfumes, hair colors, nail polish, creams and powders. She is always dreaming of having a shop of her own.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 50 años de edad, pequeña comerciante de prendas de oro y plata que vende hace varios años.
Iniciando con poco dinero, propio que su esposo dio. El trabaja en servicio de vigilancia.
Su familia se conforma de cinco hijos, mayores de edad. Pues han sido el impulso para salir hacia delante.
La vida no es fácil hay que trabajar duro para lograr el desarrollo y educación de los hijos. Gracias al financiamiento que la institución ha dado durante siete periodos ha aumentado en cantidad de productos, pues son joyas que hay que tener capital en efectivo para comprar y luego ubicarlas a sus mejores clientes.
Con este préstamo comprara: 
Varias pulseras, cadenas, anillos, gargantillas, de plata y oro laminado. Esperando vender más.
texts.en:
Maria is a 50-year-old woman and a small-scale vendor of gold and silver jewelry, which she has sold for several years. She started with just a little money which her husband gave her. His work is providing guard services. Her family includes five children who are already grown. They were Maria's inspiration for getting ahead. Life is not easy for Maria; she has had to work hard to raise and educate her children. Thanks to the financing that the institution has granted through seven loan cycles, she has expanded the number of products she offers. Since she is working with jewelry, she has to have capital in cash to buy the items and then later sell them to her best customers. With this loan, she will buy various silver and gold-plated bracelets, chains and necklaces, with the hope of increasing her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in sets of silver and gold-plated jewelry to increase her sales

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Inés tiene 38 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Dese hace 3 años, se dedica a la preparación de comida, entre las más solicitadas son: seco a la huachana, ají de gallina, arroz con pollo, tallarín verde y salsa de carne, que son platillos peruanos. Atiende en su casa y a la vez reparte a los diversos puntos aledaños donde vive. Sus clientes son los comerciantes del mercado, que trabajan frente a su casa  y demás personas que transitan cerca. En un inicio su trabajo era  muy agotador; hoy en día le ayuda otra persona a quien le paga diario. Inés, esta  satisfecha por el trabajo que desempeña y lo rentable que le resulta. Para más adelante piensa ampliar su negocio y renovar la infraestructura de su casa. Es el dieciseisavo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y sabe que le es de mucha utilidad para aumentar el capital de su negocio, por lo que se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. Inés tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de calaminas y cementos, de ese modo cambiar el techo de su cocina, y evitar ser afectada por temporada de invierno.
texts.en:
Inés is 38 years old and is a very hard-working mother. She lives with her husband and their 3 children in their own house. For 3 years she has made a living preparing food. Among the meals she sells are: seco a la huachana [beef stew flavored with cilantro], ají de gallina [chicken with a special sauce], arroz con pollo [rice with chicken], tallarín verde [green noodles], and salsa de carne [meat with a special sauce], all of which are traditional Peruvian dishes. Inés prepares the meals in her home and then delivers them to various places near where she lives. Her customers are the merchants of the market who work in front of her house, along with people who pass through the neighborhood. In the beginning her job was very exhausting, but now she has help from another person whom she pays every day. Inés is pleased with the work she does, and it is profitable. In the future she wants to expand her business and improve her house’s infrastructure. This is Inés’s sixteenth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she knows that it will be very helpful for increasing her business’s capital. She promises to make all of her payments on time. Inés plans to use the loan she is requesting to purchase corrugated iron and cement, which she will use to replace the roof over her kitchen, and thus avoid being affected by the winter season.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing corrugated iron and cement to improve her kitchen’s infrastructure

loans.name: Unidas Con Cristo 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Maria, the coordinator of her group Unidas con Cristo 1 & 2 (Unite with Christ), is excited to be taking out her first loan. This Esperanza associate began with us because she wanted to start a business but lacked sufficient capital, so the program went to her community and she invited some neighbors. Maria plans to use this loan to buy clothing, cosmetics and accessories in order to begin her enterprise, and she will use her profits to buy school supplies and in the future a house. Maria makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and seven children. She says that her most difficult challenge is for her partner to bring home more money.

Maria's story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy clothing, accessories etc.

loans.name: Jasmina Elibeth

texts.es: Jasmina Elibeth tiene 34 años, tiene 1 hijos menor de edad a su cargo, ella cuenta con una buena clientela, que siempre llega a su vivienda pues saben que ofrecer mercadería en general. Jasmina se dedica a esto desde hace más de 12 años ella trabaja todos los días y desde muy joven a prendió a ganarse la vida y sufragar los gastos de su hogar. Por lo que no es su primera experiencia con financiamientos, pues han sido necesarios para su negocio. Ella solicita este crédito con el objetivo de comprar   perfumes, ropa interior, ropa en general y tratamientos para el cabello y la piel.
texts.en:
Jasmina Elibeth is 34 years old and has one young son, whom she supports. She has good customers who always go to her house because they know that she offers general merchandise. Jasmia has been doing this for more than 12 years. She’s been working every day since she was very young and learned how to make a living and earn enough to pay her household expenses. This is not her first experience with financing, as it has been necessary for her business. She is asking for this loan in order to buy perfume, undergarments, general clothing items, and hair and skin treatments.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 51 años, es una madre D. familia muy jovial, vive en compañía D. su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Hace más D. 15 años se dedica en L. venta D. periódico, revista y algunos dulces. Cada mañana al llegar a su kiosco ordena los productos que tiene, D. manera que sea más vistoso posible  para su fácil venta. Su punto D. venta es en L. periferia del mercado junto a L. avenida principal D. L. ciudad, donD. sus compradores son los chóferes D. buses y personas que transitan cerca D. ahí. Se siente muy complacida por su negocio; ya que dice distraerse mucho conversando con sus clientes. En adelante,  piensa en terminar D. construir  su casa para el bienestar D. sus hijos y  diversificar su negocio. Es su décimo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas oportunamente, asimismo con sus compañeras D. su grupo es muy atenta y se lleva con todas ellas. Con este crédito que solicita, comprará revistas D. todos los rubros, y D. ese modo tener variedad D. revistas en su kiosco.
texts.en:
Victoria is 51 years old and the mother of a very happy family. She lives with her husband and their two children. For more than 15 years she has maD. a living selling newspapers, magazines and some candies. Every morning she arrives at her kiosk and sets up her items to make them as visible as possible to ensure an easy sale. Her newsstand is on the outskirts of the market along the city's main avenue, where her customers are bus drivers and people who pass through there. Victoria is very pleased with her business and says she really enjoys conversing with her clients. In the future, she plans to finish construction on her home to improve her children's well-being, and to also diversify her business. This is her 10th loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to make her payments on time. Along with her fellow group members she is very attentive and gets along with all of them. With the loan she is requesting, she plans to purchase magazines for all kinds of trades and in this way add more variety of magazines to her kiosk.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock up on a wider variety of magazines

loans.name: El Manguito Group

texts.es:
La señora Lucila Gómez Pérez vive en la Ribera General Sandino, Municipio de Copainala,  Estado de Chiapas México. Tiene treinta  y tres años de edad, está casada con el señor Rosendo Sánchez López con quien tiene tres hijas pequeñas  que van en la primaria: Blanca Roceli de once años, Marilú de nueve y Natalia de cuatro años,  la cual se siente muy orgullosa de  sus tres niñas que son su razón de trabajar y seguir adelante.

  Ella es ama de casa y se dedica a la comercialización de ganado porcino desde hace cinco años,  y dice que es un trabajo donde se obtiene muy buenas ganancias,  ya que día con día incrementa su negocio.

  La que lo motivo a realizar esta actividad fue su esposo quien  la  ánimo a dedicar su tiempo en un trabajo que le sacara provecho y comenta que es algo  bonito pues con el dinero que obtiene a construido su cocina  en donde hace los alimentos para su familia.

  Lucila vende los marranos cuando ya están gordos y con las ganancias compra más para volverlos a criar dándoles  una buena alimentación ya que de ello obtiene ingresos para su hogar  y gastos pequeños.
  Ella forma parte de un grupo llamado "El Manguito" y formó este grupo gracias a su mama quien fue que formó el grupo de tres personas, la razón del nombre es porque en casa de la representante hay un árbol de mango.
 Las personas que integran este grupo son la siguiente:

 María del Rosario C. A.: compra marranos para engordarlos y luego venderlos aliñados.
 Lucila González Pérez: es la señora que se le tomo la entrevista utiliza el préstamo para la compra de marrano engordarlos y luego venderlos.
 Máxima Pérez Sánchez: se dedica a la comercialización de ganado vacuno y porcino.
texts.en:
Lucila Gómez Pérez lives in Ribera General Sandino, municipality of Copainala, state of Chiapas, Mexico. She is 33 years old and married to Rosendo Sánchez López, with whom she has three small children who are in primary school: Blanca Roceli, age 11; Marilú, 9; and Natalia, 4. She is very proud of her children, who are her reason to work and keep making headway. Lucila is a housewife and has made a living selling pigs for the past five years. She says that it is a job where she obtains very good profits since her business is growing every day. Her husband motivated her to start the job, encouraging her to dedicate her time to work and make a profit. She says that it has been a good thing because with the money she made she built a kitchen where she can make meals for her family. Lucila sells the pigs once they are fattened, and with the profits she purchases more to raise with quality feed so she can continue making income for her household and to cover small expenses. Lucila is part of a group of three called "El Manguito" (The Little Mango), which was formed thanks to her mother, who brought together the three women. The reason for the name is because there is a mango tree at the representative's house. The group members are: Lucila; María del Rosario C. A., who buys pigs to fatten then sell; and Máxima Pérez Sánchez, who raises cattle and pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs and feed

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer, comerciante, que gracias al apoyo por medio de los financiamientos, en Afodenic ha logrado la inversión de su pequeño cafetín y ventas de productos.
Pues lleva varios años vendiendo para poder pagar los gastos básicos de su hogar ya que su esposo es albañil y gana poco.
Así puede ayudar  a sus hijos con lo poco que puede.
Con sus préstamos ha hecho mejoras en su casa, y esta contenta por hacer posible la inversión.
Hará un muro que tendrá de objetivo mejorar la privacidad y mejor cuidado contra la delincuencia que ha aumentado, en la parte de atrás ya esta cerrado por el vecino lo cual le es de mucho beneficios, el muro lo hará en la parte de alado, aprovechando a la misma vez dejar las divisiones de dos cuartos.
Para esto  comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Maria is a woman who thanks to the support of loans from Kiva partner Afodenic has been able to invest in her small cafe and store. She has spent a number of years selling items in order to be able to pay basic bills for her household, since her husband is a construction worker and doesn't earn much. So she helps their children with what she can. With the loans she has made improvements to her home, and she is pleased with the investments. Next, there will be a wall that will improve their privacy and better protect them against the rising crime. The back is already closed off by a neighbor, which they have benefited from. The wall will be built along the side, and at the same time they will divide a room into two. To do this she will purchase construction materials such as bricks, sand, cement and iron to carry out the work.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall along the side of her home and also divide a room into two

loans.name: Mahanaim Group

texts.es:
Mahanaim es un grupo conformado por 14 personas que aparte de llevar una buena amistad tienen algo en común, todos dedican su vida a Dios. Ellos se ubican en la comunidad de Valle de Chalco, Estado de México. Los integrantes son: Víctor Fidel R. C. (Taxi), Beatriz O. C. (Venta de Piñatas). Raquel C. Álvarez (Representante-Perfumes y cosméticos por catalogo), Leticia García C. (Tratamientos Faciales por catalogo), Aquilina Z. Hernández (cosméticos por catalogo), Juan José R. C. (Venta de playeras y pantalones), Olivia García C. (Renta de madera), Alejandra Sánchez O. (Venta de Dulces y Frituras), Zeferina Hernández Hernández (Venta de arreglos florales), Rosa María B. Juárez (Venta de Piñatas), María Magdalena Juárez L. (Venta de carne), Sara Z. Hernández (Venta de macetas y plantas), Catalina Z. Hernández (Tienda de ropa) y Guadalupe María Guzmán C. (Venta de dulces).

Rosa María de 33 años de edad con una familia conformada por sus tres hijos los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar. Desde hace cuatro años se dedica a la elaboración de piñatas, ya que su familia se ha dedicado a este oficio durante mucho tiempo y a ella le fue gustando el trabajo. Al principio le fue difícil hacerse de sus clientes ya que iba comenzando, así que decidió armar un catalogo con las diferentes figuras para mostrarlas y así la gente fuera conociendo su trabajo, con su perseverancia ha logrado que sus piñatas sean vendidas en los centros comerciales y en dulcerías, sus ventas incrementan en las fiestas decembrinas y  bajan un poco a principios de año pero para ella esto no es motivo como para dejar de echarle ganas y seguir trabajando. Sus planes son poder expandir su negocio y que mas gente conozca el trabajo que realiza. El crédito solicitado lo va a utilizar para la compra de materiales como; papel de diferentes colores, pegamento, cartón, etc. Y obtener un poco mas de ganancias para invertir en los estudios de sus hijos.

Mahanaim agradece el apoyo brindado que recibe de Kiva por parte de Fundación Realidad ya que esto les ayudara a cumplir sus metas
texts.en:
Mahanaim is a group of 14 people who, along with a great friendship, have something else in common: they all dedicate their lives to God. The group is located in the community of Valle de Chalco in the State of Mexico. The members are: Víctor Fidel R. C. (taxi service), Beatriz O. C. (piñata sales), Raquel C. Álvarez (perfume and cosmetic sales by catalog), Leticia García C. (facial treatment sales by catalog), Aquilina Z. Hernández (cosmetic sales by catalog), Juan José R. C. (t-shirt and pants sales), Olivia García C. (wood sales), Alejandra Sánchez O. (sweets and fried food sales), Zeferina Hernández Hernández (floral arrangement sales), Rosa María B. Juárez (piñata sales), María Magdalena Juárez L. (meat sales), Sara Z. Hernández (plant and flowerpot sales), Catalina Z. Hernández (clothing store), and Guadalupe María Guzmán C. (candy sales). Rosa María is 33 years old, with a family made up of three school-age children. She has been making piñatas for four years, as this was something her family has been doing for a long time and she enjoyed the work. At the beginning it was difficult to bring in customers since she was just starting, so she decided to equip herself with a catalog of the different figures, which she could show to customers. This way, people could get to know her work. Through perseverance, she has succeeded in having her piñatas sold in commercial centers and candy shops. Her sales increase during the December holidays and drop a bit at the beginning of the year, but for her this is no reason to lose motivation and she keeps working. Her plans are to expand her business and to have more people know her work. She will use the requested loan to buy materials like different colors of tissue paper, glue, cardboard, etc., and to bring in a little more income to invest in her children's education. Mahanaim is grateful for the the support offered by Kiva through Fundación Realidad, as it will help them to reach their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tissue paper of various colors, glue, cardboard, ribbon, sweets, fried foods, flowers, and cosmetics

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Braulio Manuel

texts.es: Braulio Manuel tiene 30 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de ropa nueva pues siempre está pendiente de entregar a sus clientes los pedidos que le realizan, el vende su ropa de manera ambulante y en su vivienda. El viaja hasta Managua para realizar las compras de sus productos a precios más favorables por lo que sus clientes siempre le están solicitando una gran variedad de mercadería. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de pantalones, camisetas, ropa interior y sabanas. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es seguir con este negocio e incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Braulio Manuel is 30 years old. He buys and sells new clothing and always makes sure to deliver his customers’ orders to them. He sells his items on foot as well as out of his home. He travels to Managua to buy his products at favorable prices because his customers are constantly requesting a variety of merchandise. He is asking for this loan in order to invest in pants, shirts, undergarments, and sheets. He feels that this loan will give him the opportunity to get ahead. He hopes to be able to continue this business and increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Confiar En Dios Group

texts.es: La señora Odilia F. M. de 50 años de edad, es originaria de patzicia, Chimaltenango, tiene tres hijos dos que aun estan a su cargo y uno casado, actualmente vive en Chimaltenango, ella tiene venta de tamales y chiles rellenos, hace seis años, ahora ella solicita el crédito para poder ampliar su negocio. Doña Maria, ella tiene una venta de joyas de oro, pero ademas de la venta de joyas, tiene venta de refacciones en chimlatenango. El señor Jose tiene venta de refacciones en chimaltenango y ademas tiene terrenos donde siembra milpa y frijol y y tiene dos personas que le ayudan a la siembra y cosecha de la milpa y el frijo, y también tiene un pick up donde hace fletes.
texts.en:
Odilia F. M. is 50 years old and originally from Patzicia, Chimaltenango, Guatemala. She has three children, two of whom are still under her care and another who is married. She currently lives in Chimaltenango. She has made a living selling tamales and chiles rellenos for the past six years, and is requesting the loan to be able to expand her business. Maria makes a living selling gold jewelry and also sells spare parts in Chimaltenango. Jose makes a living selling spare parts in Chimaltenango and also has some land where he plants maize and beans. He has two people who help him plans and harvest the crops, and he also has a pickup truck he uses to freight.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 39-year-old man who is married to a teacher. Together, they have eight children, all of school-going age. As most Ugandans think nowadays, he dreams of seeing all his children fully educated for a brighter future.

John lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda, where he operates a cocoa business by purchasing cocoa and reselling it at a profit. He has been in this business for five years. He faces transport constraints when doing his business activities. He says that, before, he operated a retail shop.

The purpose of the loan is to purchase more cocoa to resell at a profit.

loans.use: To purchase more coca to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Family expenses

loans.name: Clare

texts.en:
Clare is a 39-year-old lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is married with five children aged 14, 11, 8, 5 and 3. She lives with nine people in her home. She says for now, her family resides in staff quarters since she is a teacher at one of the schools around town. Her husband is also a teacher.

Clare operates a brick-making business which she started early this year. She hopes to do commercial brick-making on a large scale.

Clare hopes to construct her own house for her family’s residence. The purpose of the loan is to buy building materials for completion of her house aimed at generating income from tenants.

loans.use: To buy building materials for completion of her house aimed at generating income from tenants

loans.name: Par Cisse Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois de PAR C. a été inauguré le 04 décembre 2007, au sortir de son Assemblée Générale Constitutive. Il est composé de 29 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village qui porte également le même nom que le Banc Villageois. Le Banc Villageois est à sa troisième année et ses membres ont 06 fois bénéficié de crédit de CAURIE-MICRO FINANCE. 

Madame NGONE SAER S., debout à l'extrême droite de la photo est la Présidente du Banc Villageois. Elle est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants, elle a aussi la charge d'1 neveu.

Elle faisait de la transformation et vente d'huile d'arachide comme activité. Mais avec son nouveau Crédit elle va changer d'activité en faisant de l'embouche ovine. 

Son prêt de 50.000 franc CFA lui permettra d'acheter un mouton et de l'aliment de bétail pour engraisser l'animal pendant au moins 4 mois avant de le revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaire de sa localité.

Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille. Surtout en ce qui concerne la scolarité de ses enfants et la nourriture.
texts.en:
The Par C. "Banc Villageois" was established December 4, 2007, following its initial General Assembly. The "Banc Villageois" is composed of 29 women from the village of the same name. The "Banc Villageois" is in its third year and its members have benefited from six loans by CAURIE micro-finance. Mrs. Saer S. Ngone, standing at the right of the picture, is President of the "Banc Villageois". She is 40 years old. She is married and the mother of six children. She also cares for one nephew. Mrs. Ngone used to make and sell peanut oil, but with her new loan she will change her business and start fattening sheep. She will use her 50,000 franc loan to buy one sheep and animal feed, which will allow her to fatten the animal for at least 4 months before she sells it in the weekly markets in her area. Her goal is to contribute to improving the living conditions of her family, especially with respect to schooling her children and food.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sheep

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis wants a loan to enable him buy a new motorcycle for his transport business. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda, and is married to a peasant wife with three children.

Francis has been in the motorcycle transport business for ten years now, having started as a hired rider of other people’s motorcycles. He says, in his business the authorities disturb their work flow. He, however, hopes to work harder to buy a car for his family.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for his transport business

loans.name: Evarist

texts.en: The thinking of many Ugandans today is that those employed formally are missing out on the opportunity of income from business ventures, and many of them are beginning to have side incomes to supplement their salaries to make ends meet. Evarist falls in that category. Evarist is 39 years old and married with one child. He is a teacher living in Fort Portal, Uganda with five dependents. The purpose of this loan is to enable him to buy land for commercial building construction.

loans.use: To purchase land for commercial building

loans.name: Estalin Walther

texts.es:
Estalin Walther G. G. tiene 28 anos. Vive soltero en el canton de Chillanes en la província de Bolívar.

Estalin es un socio de la ventanilla rural Genesis, que esta ubicada casi 2 horas de Chillanes. Son 11 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz, arroz, soya, plátano, papaya, y otros.

Estalin se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maiz. Realiza las compras y las ventas de sus productos en Mata de Cacao y en Babahoyo 3 veces al mes.  

Solicita el credito para crecer mas maiz. El prestamo lo permitiria ahorrar en cada temporada, últimamente llegando a crecer mas. La cooperativa lo ayuda bastante. 

Le gusta jugar futbol y escuchar musica.
texts.en:
Estalin Walter G. G. is 28 years old. He is single and lives in the canton of Chillanes in Bolívar province. Estalin is a member of the “Genesis” communal bank, which is located almost 2 hours from Chillanes. There are 11 members in total, and the majority of them grow corn, rice, soy, plantains, papaya, and other crops. Estalin works in agriculture. He grows corn. He makes purchases and sells his products in Mata de Cacao and in Babahoyo three times per month. He is requesting the loan to grow more corn. The loan will allow him to save each season, which will ultimately allow him to grow more. The communal bank is very helpful for him. He likes to play soccer and listen to music.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To plant corn

loans.name: Veronica Marina

texts.es:
Veronica Marina P. G. tiene 24 años.  Vive en unión libre el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Veronica es una socia de la ventanilla rural El Placer, que está ubicada a tres horas de Chillanes. Son 19 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Verónica cria chanchos. Realiza sus compras y ventas en Mata de Cacao. Los chancos se venden en la casa. 
Solicita el préstamo para comprar mas animales. Su sueño es trabajar y seguir adelante. 

En su tiempo libre arregla la casa y ayuda a su esposo a sembrar cacao.
texts.en:
Veronica Marina P. G. is 24 years old. She lives in a civil union in the Chillanes district, Bolívar province. Veronica is a member of the rural communal group El Placer, which is located 3 hours from Chillanes. There are 19 members in total, and the majority work growing maize and cocoa. This is the first loan that they are seeking from Cooperativa San José. Veronica breeds pigs. She makes her purchases and sales in Mata de Cacao, and also sells them at home. She is seeking a loan to purchase more animals. Veronica's dream is to continue working and improve her situation. In her spare time Veronica tidies the house and helps her husband to plant cocoa.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens and pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Maria Piedad

texts.es:
La Señora. María Piedad L. es socia del banco comunal Mujer y Fortaleza, vive en la comunidad de Punta Corral que es perteneciente al parroquia de Turi, la mismas que es reconocida por ser el mirador del la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, mucha de su población ha migrado para ofrecer a sus familias un mejor futuro.

Nuestra socia se dedica hace 10 años al bordado de polleras y blusas que son la vestimenta típica de la región, aprendió este bonito arte gracias a que su mamá y también ha seguido cursos de costura, trabaja sin horario gracias a que cuenta con su propio taller.
 
La Señora María Piedad tiene 28 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 9, 7 y 5 años de edad, todos sus hijos están en la escuela, su esposo es albañil; no tienen  casa propia por lo que viven en la casa de sus padres.

Es nuestra socia hace 5 años y los créditos le han beneficiado mucho en su taller, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una máquina de coser, en hilo y varios materiales más que necesita. Su sueño es llegar a tener un almacén para vender todo el producto que elabora.
texts.en:
María Piedad L. is a member of the “Mujer y Fortaleza” (Women and Strength”) communal bank. She lives in the Punta Corral area of Turi, known as a viewpoint over the city of Cuenca. The people in her community are farmers and raise livestock, though many have left the area in search of opportunities to better provide for their families. For over 10 years María Piedad has embroidered skirts and blouses that are the traditional dress of the region. She learned this beautiful skill from her mother and by taking sewing courses. Since she has her own sewing studio she makes her own hours. María Piedad is 28 years old, married, and has three children, ages, 9, 7, and 5. All of her children are in school and her husband works in construction. They live in her parents’ house as they do not have their own home. She has been a member of the communal bank for five years and the loans she has received have greatly assisted the development of her sewing studio. She will invest this loan in the purchase of a sewing machine, thread, and other necessary materials. Her dream is to one day have a store where she can sell all the items that she creates.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine, thread, fabric, etc.

loans.name: Maria Carmita

texts.es:
La Señora María Carmita C. es socia del banco comunal Mujer y Fortaleza, vive en la comunidad de Punta Corral que es perteneciente al parroquia de Turi, la misma que es reconocida por ser el mirador del la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura mucha de su población ha migrado para ofrecer a sus familias un mejor futuro.

Nuestra socia tiene 37 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 18, 14 y 10 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y todo su dinero es para sus gastos personales, su segundo hijo estudia en el colegio y su última hija estudia en la escuela; su esposo es albañil y con el esfuerzo de los dos han podido construir su casa propia.

La Señora. María Carmita se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y aprovecha el tiempo en su casa para dedicarse a la cría de pollos y cuyes a los mismos que los vende vivos en su comunidad.

Se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo, fue invitada por una amiga a formar parte de este gran grupo de señoras, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento. Su meta es llegar a comprar una camioneta para vender sus pollos.
texts.en:
María Carmita C. is a member of the “Mujer y Fortaleza” (Women and Strength”) community bank. She lives in the Punta Corral area of Turi, known as a viewpoint over the city of Cuenca. The people in her community are farmers and raise livestock, though many have left the area in search of opportunities to better provide for their families. María Carmita is 37 years old, married, and has three children, ages 18, 14, and 10. Her oldest son works and uses his income to cover his personal expenses. Her second son is in high school and her young daughter is in elementary school. Her husband works in construction. Their hard work has enabled them to build their own home. María Carmita is a homemaker and uses her free time to raise chickens and guinea pigs to sell in her community. A friend invited her to be a part of this great group of women and now she is in her fourth loan cycle. She will invest this loan in the purchase of chickens and feed. Her goal is to be able to buy a pickup truck to use to sell her chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens and chicken feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Household expenses

loans.name: Salvadora

texts.es: Salvadora tiene 1 hijo a su cargo, con mucho esfuerzo esta señora ha logrado tener su propio medio de vida. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada, hace más de 2 años que tiene este negocio, es una persona muy responsable y se encuentra muy contenta de hablar con sus clientes pues todos los días se siente bendecida por tener los clientes que tiene en la actualidad, ya que con el paso del tiempo ha obtenido la experiencia requerida. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima como faldas, pantalones, camisetas y ropa interior.
texts.en:
Salvadora has worked hard to make her way in life. She has one son and is a very responsible person. For more than 2 years she has sold new and used clothing and she truly enjoys talking with her customers. Every day she feels blessed to have such great customers and to have developed the experience necessary to work with them. She will use this loan to purchase merchandise such as skirts, trousers, t-shirts, and underwear.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock her store with soft drinks and beer

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora María Rosario Chimbo es socia del banco comunal Mujer y Fortaleza, vive en la comunidad de Punta Corral que es perteneciente al parroquia de Turi, la mismas que es reconocida por ser el mirador del la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, mucha de su población ha migrado para ofrecer a sus familias un mejor futuro.

La Señora. María Rosario tiene 48 años, es casada y tiene 9 hijos de los cuales 6 son casados, 4 viven independientemente y 2 viven con ella compartiendo los gastos del hogar, sus 3 últimos hijos estudian,  uno en la universidad, otro en el colegio y su último hijo en la escuela; su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías como es el bordado, actividad que la realiza hace 12 años y aprendido en varios cursos que ha recibido en su comunidad,cuenta con un pequeño taller en donde labora de lunes a sábado sin horarios y ahora es doña María Rosario quien dicta los cursos de bordados a sus demás compañeras de la comunidad.

Es una socia fundadora del banco comunal y se siente muy contenta de formar parte de un gran grupo de mujeres luchadoras, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de tela, hilo y muchos más materiales para su pequeño taller, su meta es agrandar su taller para incrementar su producción.
texts.en:
María Rosario Chimbo is a member of the Mujer y Fortaleza (Women and Strength) community bank. She lives in the community of Punta Corral, which is in the parish of Turi, known for its views of the city of Cuenca.
