No contento con ello, anhela adquirir más terrenos con la finalidad de que pueda producir a gran escala y de esa manera pueda generar mejores ingresos económicos. Este es su decimotercer crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con sus respectivos pagos, además esta contento con su banco comunal, ya que existe un compromiso de pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de insumos y abono para mejorar la producción de cacao y hoja de coca.
texts.en:
Guillermina is 56 years old, widowed, and has four grown children who work independently. She lives in her own home in the town of Santo Rosa, which is located on the edge of the Peruvian jungle. Guillermina remembers first getting involved in farming when she was a teenager, helping with the chores that were given to her by her parents. Today she produces and sells agricultural products such as cacao and coca leaves. Her most frequent customers are satisfied with the quality of the products she offers. As a result, she has gained a strong position in the local market since her sales have improved compared to her previous harvests. Guillermina normally receives assistance from her children during the planting and harvesting seasons. Her normal work schedule is from 7am to 6pm, Monday through Saturday. The crops she produces are sold at the local collection centers. Guillermina is not content at the moment, so she plans to acquire more land in hopes of producing on a larger scale and generating more income.

This is her thirteenth loan with MFP. Guillermina is confident that she will faithfully complete her payments. She is happy with her Communal Bank because the others are also committed with their payments. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of supplies and organic fertilizers to improve her production of cacao and coca leaves.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies & organic fertilizers

loans.name: Emma Aracely

texts.es: Emma tiene 29 años es casada y tiene 3 hijos y estan en edad escolar, ella trabaja en su propio negocio los jueves y domingos, algunas veces martes, vendiendo tarugos, botas caites de hule en el mercado municipal de San Martín Jilotepeque, esta contenta porque Dios la a bendecido en su negocio a parte de eso ella vende ollas, de barro y baños y palanganas de platicos. Ella se esmera por mantener la clientela atendiendo amablemente. Solicita el crédito para compara botas, tarugos chinitas de plastico y palanganas.ñ Sueña con alquilar un local para poder vender sus Zapatos de plastico y con forme el tiempo una zapateria.
texts.en:
Emma is 29 years old, married, and has three school age children. She works at her own business on Thursdays, Sundays, and occasionally on Tuesdays. Emma sells shoe pegs, boots, and rubber sandals at the municipal market of San Martín Jilotepeque. She is very happy because God has blessed her in her business. In addition, she sells clay pots and plastic washbasins and bowls. She strives to maintain her customer base by providing friendly service.

Emma is requesting a loan to buy boots, shoe pegs, plastic dishes, and basins. She dreams of renting a space where she can sell plastic shoes and eventually open a shoe store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase boots, shoe pegs, plastic dishes, and basins

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Vilma Elena

texts.es: Vilma Elena tiene 42 años, su actividad es una pulpería, hace más de 2 años que se dedica a este medio de vida. Desde muy pequeña, Vilma aprendió a trabajar es una labor que ha estado en su familia desde hace muchos años, esta actividad le dio el capital necesario para iniciar su negocio en al vivienda, la cual le está dando muy buenas ganancias, convirtiéndose poco a poco en su actividad principal. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es la comunicación que tiene con sus vecinos cuando entran a su establecimiento a comprarle algo, en donde considera que para tener lo que ha logrado tiene que sacrificarse y permanecer en su tienda todo el día. Con el tiempo espera ampliar las instalaciones de su negocio para brindarle a sus clientes una mejor comodidad. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará productos como golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas y detergentes.
texts.en:
Vilma Elena is 42 years old and has been managing a store for more than two years to earn a living. At a young age she learned that work is an important part of her family’s life and has been for many years. By working she was able to earn enough capital to start a business from home. Now that she generates good earnings, she has gradually made her business her primary activity. What she enjoys most about her work is being able to converse with the neighbors who come by her store to shop. Vilma says that everything she has achieved was a result of sacrifice and being able to stay at her store the entire day. Over time she hopes to expand her facilities so that her customers will be more comfortable.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products such as candy, soft drinks, bread, cookies, and detergents.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Cabañitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. Cabañitas tiene como presidenta a la señora Elena, la mencionada asociación comunal pertenece al Centro Focal de Senkata. 

La señora Elena, cuenta con cuarenta y seis años de edad, esposa, madre, presidenta de su asociación comunal, tambien, lleva adelante su propio negocio.  

Desde hace diez años ella abrio una tienda de barrio y tambien vender en la Feria.  Su primer crédito fue de Bs. 500.- hace diez años, ahora su solicitud de crédito es por Bs2000.- Los días de feria Lunes, Martes, Miércoles, es colaborada por su hijo de catorce años.

Con respecto a Pro Mujer ella indica que los que más le gusta es el Consultorio de Salud, por que le atienden bien.

Las integrantes de la asociación comunal, son ocho mujeres y un varón. Tienen negocios diferentes, como: venta de fruta, tienda de barrio, venta de zapatos, panadería, cisterna, tejidos, venta de ropa, venta de DVD y VCD, venta de abarrotes.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Cabañitas” (Little Huts) is led by their president, Sra. Elena. The group is part of the Senkata Community Center. Sra. Elena is 46 years old. She is a wife, mother, and president of her Communal Association. Elena also runs her own business. Ten years ago, she opened a neighborhood store and also began selling at the fair. She received her first loan, which was in the amount of 500 BOB, ten years ago. Now she is requesting a loan for 2000 BOB. The days on which she attends the fairs are Mondays, Tuesdays, and Wednesdays. Her 14 year old son works as her assistant. Regarding Pro Mujer, Elena says what she likes most is the health clinic because she receives good care. The members of this Communal Association consist of eight women and one man. They have different businesses consisting of the following: fruit sales, a neighborhood store, shoe sales, a bakery, digging wells, weaving, clothing sales, DVD and VCD sales, and grocery sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, noodles, and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: Irene, de 51 años de edad, convive con su pareja y fruto del amor tiene tres hijos, Carlos, Lerner e Iris de 6, 5 y 3 años respectivamente. Juntos viven en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, ubicada en al localidad de Santa Rosa, donde tienen su casa propia. Cuando era muy joven, sus padres sufrieron una recaída en su producción agrícola y desde luego que sus ingresos se reducieron a tal punto que no tenían ni para comer. Con el tiempo incursionaron en el rubro de la carpintería, de esa manera se valió para sobrevivir, actualmente su pareja le ayuda en todo los aspectos, y fruto del esfuerzo incansable obtuvieron su premio.  Hoy tiene bien posicionado su carpintería en su localidad, en donde ofrece todo variedad de muebles, que ellos mismo fabrican. Es por ello que percibe buenas ganancias económicas con respecto a los años anteriores y reconoce que la clave de su éxito es el amor al trabajo. Normalmente trabaja con su esposo y juntos hacen un buen equipo de trabajo, solo que en temporada necesita de operarios con el propósito de que lo pueda agilizar en la fabricación de muebles. Su rutina diaria es a partir de las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 8:00 de la noche y su punto de venta lo realiza en su misma localidad. Sus planes a futuro es ampliar su carpintería, con la finalidad de que pueda producir a gran escala muebles de todos los estilos y formas, según los gustos y preferencias de sus clientes. Este es su decimocuarto crédito con MFP, por el cual augura cumplir fielmente con su cronograma de pagos, además está satisfecho con su grupo comunal, por las buenas relaciones que existe en cada uno de sus socios. Con el crédito que solicita, lo piensa invertir en la compra de madera como: tornillo, caoba, y quinacho con la finalidad de que pueda producir muebles a cantidades considerables, para que así pueda vender su producto a un precio justo.
texts.en:
Irene, who is 51 years old, lives with her partner and the fruit of their love, three children, Carlos, Lerner and Iris. Their children are 6, 5 and 3 years old respectively. They live together in their own home in the Santa Rosa neighborhood of the beautiful Ayacuchan jungle. When she was very young, Irene's parents suffered a decline in their agricultural production. Because of that, their income was reduced to the point that they didn't even have food to eat. With time, they ventured into the area of carpentry, and they managed to survive. Currently, her partner helps her in all aspects, and due to their tireless efforts, they were granted their reward. Today their workshop, where they sell a wide variety of furniture that they make themselves, is well positioned in their neighborhood. Because of that, they earn a good profit, compared with earlier years. Irene recognizes that the key componenet of their success is their love of the work. She normally works with her husband, and together they make a good team, but at times they need additional workers to speed up the fabrication of the furniture. Their daily routine starts at 8:00 in the morning and lasts until 8:00 at night. Their point of sale is in the same nieghborhood they live in. Her future plans are to expand her workshop, with the goal of producing all styles and shapes of furniture on a large scale, according to the likes and preferences of her customers. This is her fourteenth loan with MFP, which shows that she will loyally comply with her re-payment time line. In addition, she is satisfied with her communal group, with the good relationships that she has with each of the members. With the loan she is requesting, she intends to invest in the purchase of wood, such as tornillo, mahogany and quinacho, with the goal of producing large quantities of furniture so she can sell her products at a fair price.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood for making furniture.

loans.name: Santos Nicolas

texts.es:
Santos es un padre de familia de 37 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el sector Pacanguilla del distrito de Pacanga, distrito de la provincia de Chepén, ubicado en la región La Libertad, la zona se encuentra situada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente de una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para ser utilizada en labores de transporte) el brinda sus servicio dentro de la localidad en donde vive y también en los diversos sectores situados alrededor. Con los ingresos que percibe de este negocio solventa los gastos familiares.

Santos se esfuerza diariamente en la labor que realiza para así poder sacar adelante a su familia, lamentablemente el estado accidentado de los caminos que suele frecuentar y el excesivo uso otorgado a su unidad movil han hecho que su mototaxi empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para que pueda funcionar correctamente. Para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Santos es una persona trabajadora y que se esfuerza constantemente para poder sacar adelante a su familia, en la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le considera alguien honrado y tranquilo.
texts.en:
Santos is a 37 year old father who lives with his wife and two children in the Pacanguilla sector of the District of Pacanga, Chepén Province, which is located in the region of La Libertad. This area is an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Santos provides cargo and passenger transport services using his motorcycle taxi (a motorized vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with an attached cabin used for transporting goods or people). He provides his services within his town and also in the neighboring sectors. With the income he generates from his business, Santos is able to pay for his family expenses.

He strives every day at his job so that his family can get ahead. Unfortunately, the poor condition of the roads and excessive use of his vehicle have resulted in problems with his motorcycle taxi that require urgent repairs necessary for it to operate properly. In order to take the appropriate action, Santos is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN.

He is a hardworking individual who constantly tries to move his family forward. In the area where he lives, Santos is considered by his neighbors and acquaintances to be someone who is honest and peaceful.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for repairs & maintenance of his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Arely Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Arely del Socorro S. L., habita en el peligroso Barrio de la Capital Laureles Norte tiene 42 años está casada y su esposo se dedica a comercializar llantas, tienen 2 hijos adolecentes, tienen una pulpería el cual es el negocio familiar, anteriormente laboraba en una zona franca al nacer el hijo menor decidió dedicarse a su hijo y las labores del hogar, tras esto y el esfuerzo del esposo lograron invertir en una miscelánea, ellos habitan en una vivienda humilde y es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción que permitan la edificación de un sumidero y cerrar la parte delantera de su hogar, esta inverfsion le permitira mejorar las condiciones precarias en las que habitan favoreciendoles con una mayor seguridad a su familia, mayor ampliación y comodidad a todos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Arely del Socorro S. L., lives in a dangerous neighborhood in the capital, Laureles Norte. She is 42 years old and married. Her husband sells tires. They have 2 teenage children. They have a grocery store, which is their family business. She used to work in a free trade zone; when the youngest child was born, she decided to dedicate herself to her children and her home. After that, and thanks to her husband's hard work, they were able to invest in a variety store. They live in a humble home, and that it why she is asking for a loan to buy construction materials which will allow her to build a drain and close in the front part of her house. This investment will allow her to improve the precarious conditions in which they live, offering better safety to her family, and more space and comfort to all.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a drain and of a wall in the back part of the house

loans.name: Damaris Marbeli

texts.es: La señora Damaris Marbeli R. T., tiene la edad de 41 años viven en el Barrio Buenos Aires, de estado civil casada y tanto su  esposo como ella laboran como maestros y con sus ingresos le apoya a los gastos del hogar, tienen 3 hijos los cuales son mayores de edad e independientes, y ayudan económicamente a sus padres en los gastos en que se incurre mensualmente, habitan en un hogar humilde y por el cual solicitan un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción con el objetivo de realizar algunas mejoras a su vivienda, ayudándoles a convivir en un espacio más digno, cómodo, amplio y seguro donde morar y brindándole la satisfacción a  los padres de ofrecerles a sus nietos un mejor espacio donde crecer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Damaris Marbeli R. T. is 41 years old. She lives in the Buenos Aires neighborhood. She is married and she and her husband work as teachers and with their incomes pay their household expenses. They have 3 children who are adult and independent. They help their parents financially with the monthly expenses. They live in a humble home and that it why they are asking for a loan to buy construction materials with the objective of improving their home. It will help them to live in a more worthy, comfortable, spacious, and safe place, giving them a better space for their grandchildren to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To remodel their home

loans.name: Aracelly Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Aracelly B. B. es una joven casada de 27 años de edad que habita en el Barrio Medardo Andino, su esposo trabaja para una empresa privada y es el responsable de informática, y con sus ingresos apoya en los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen un pequeño de 2 años el cual aun no va a preescolar, ella se dedica a realizar las labores domesticas del hogar, tienen más de 4 años de tener la necesidad de remodelar su hogar debido a que habitan en una vivienda precaria que por seguridad necesitan  invertirle a la infraestructura, y es por esta razón que solicitan materiales de construcción para llevar a cabo estas edificaciones, para el bienestar de todos los miembros del hogar.
texts.en:
Aracelly B. B. is a married young woman, 27 years old, who lives in the Medardo Andino neighborhood. Her husband works for a private business as the IT Manager. He supports the household with his income. They have a small 2-year-old who has not yet gone to preschool. Aracelly does domestic work. The couple has needed to remodel their house for over four years because they live in a meagre house. For safety reasons they need to invest in the infrastructure. They request construction materials to carry out the construction, which is for the well being of all the members of the home.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a wall

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sem O., 48 years old, owns a small shop located along the village road where she sells porridge. She typically makes around $3 in profit each day to ensure that her family has a comfortable life. She is married and blessed with seven children, some of whom are employed in a garment factory.

Sem O. has a life partner in her husband, who appears in the photo. A provider of taxi services, he currently earns little income because his vehicle is often broken. Sem O. is therefore requesting a Kiva loan to replace the broken taxi.

loans.use: To replace the broken taxi.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. K., 32, owns a small hand-cart that she uses to sell snack food around her community. She typically makes around $3 USD of profit each day to ensure that her family has a comfortable living. In addition, she and her husband always buy used goods to resell, and they are able to generate $7 USD a day from this business. The couple has been married for years and has two teenage children. One of their children is employed in a garment factory. Mrs. K. will be using her loan to buy a trailer to connect with her existing motor so that she can pick up more used goods.

loans.use: To buy a trailer to connect with existing motor

loans.name: Chhut

texts.en: Mr. H. is an old man whose wife appears in the photo shown here. H. is a civil servant officer in a ministry and earns a formal salary. He is married without any children. H. has another financial earner in his wife who owns a medium-sized workshop from which she sells all kinds of merchandise. Recently, one part of the stock inventory has been exhausted, and H. wants to resupply. He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, HKL, to purchase beer, wine, cooking ingredients and a variety of other miscellaneous items for his wife to continue selling.

loans.use: To purchase beer, wine, cooking ingredients, etc.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai S. is 45 years old, married, and devoted to her child, who is already married and lives at home. She is married to 50-year-old Chounvinh, who helps support the family by working in the construction field. Mai S. owns a small business selling fruit to villagers as a means of income.
The family is often affected by transport problems as it has no vehicle. Therefore, Mai S. has decided to seek a loan of $600 USD in order to purchase a used motorcycle to provide transport for the family.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle to provide family transport

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard L. is from the village of Bal-ason, Gingoog City. He is 39 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Richard owns and operates a specialized retail store buying and selling wood lumber in the local community. Richard has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Richard joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional lumber to sell. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional lumber to sell

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
B. Nguyễn Thị (20209050032) is a 26-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. She is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, B. owns and operates a food stall selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. B. has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,800,000 VND per month from these activities.
In 2008, B. joined Kiva partner, SEDA, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,048,000 VND from SEDA. This loan was used to invest in expanding the business. B. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her fourth from SEDA. B. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About SEDA
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. B. Nguyễn Thị (20209050032) là 26 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi nhỏ. Để kiếm sống, B. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán thức ăn nhanh & những loại thực phẩm cao cấp khác trong cộng đồng địa phương. B. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, B. kiếm được khoảng 3.800.000 VND một tháng. Vào 2008, B. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. B. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. B. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh cải thiện điều kiện sống chung của gia đình người vay. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. .

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Mrs. Bun R. is a 58-year-old married woman. She currently resides in an average house with other family members. Bun R. grows crops on her own farmland in the village. Her husband frequently works in the fields alongside her. Bun R. is the mother of three children, almost all of whom are of legal age. Her children currently work at different occupations. Bun R.’ children face difficulty traveling to their work locations because they don’t have a vehicle for commuting. To solve the problem, Bun R. decided to purchase a second-hand motorbike using the loan she has requested. (Mrs. Bun R. was not available when the photo taken, so her husband is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand motorbike

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn C. is from the village of Binakalan, Gingoog City. She is 43 years old. Jocelyn is widowed and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jocelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ream

texts.en: S., 48, has been selling vegetables in her community for nine years. S. buys vegetable in bulk from farmers and sells them retail to earn an income. Her husband is a cook who is hired by people to cook meals for their parties. He also fishes from the river, to provide food for his family and to sell to others. S. has five teenage children. Three of her children work in various jobs; the others are dependent on her. Recently, S. ordered a large amount of vegetables on credit from her supplier, and she does not have enough money to pay her supplier. Thus, she would like a loan in order to pay the bill for the vegetables.

loans.use: To pay for vegetables

loans.name: Ngô's Group

texts.en:
T. Ngô Thị (20209050027) is a 59-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. T. is the group leader of a 4-member group L. offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual L., they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Vọng Nguyệt nhóm 03 (Nhóm 03).

T. is married and has 1 adult -aged child. She owns and operates a business raising livestock for sale. T. has been engaged in this business for over 25 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from it.

In 2008, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous L. of 4,704,000 VND from SEDA. This previous L. was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. She is now requesting a new L. of 7,392,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the 4th L. taken out by T. from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  Ngô Thị L. (0) is a 31-year-old female who is requesting a 4,256,000 VND L. to support her service-based business.

2.  Chu Thị X. (0) is a 59-year-old female who is requesting a 2,016,000 VND L. to support her business raising livestock.

3.  Ngô Thị T. (0) is a 57-year-old female who is requesting a 2,016,000 VND L. to support her business raising livestock.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this L. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Nguyễn Thị (20209050027) là 59 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Vọng Nguyệt nhóm 03 (Nhóm 03 ).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 25 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.704.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Ngô Thị L. (0) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


2.  Chu Thị X. (0) là 59 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2.016.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Ngô Thị T. (0) là 57 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2.016.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.name: Elsita

texts.en:
Elsita P. is from San Miguel, Gingoog City. She is 36 years old, married, and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Elsita owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling firewood, and also selling dried fish and home-made sausage (or chorizo) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elsita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional firewood to sell. This will be Elsita’s 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood to sell

location.town: San Miguel, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Pouch

texts.en: Pouch S. is a 30-year-old married man who currently resides in the middle of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. He is blessed with two young kids who are not enrolled in school. He is a security guard who works in a public garden. Pouch started his job more than three years ago. His wife works as a cleaner and also spends time at home to take care of the kids and do household work. This family does not have a comfortable standard of living because their house does not currently have access to the local water system. Pouch hopes to connect his house to the water supply but he needs to pay the fee. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan from Kiva in order to do so.

loans.use: To pay the fee for a water connection

loans.name: Chu

texts.en:
T. Chu Thị is a 32 year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, T. owns & operates a butcher shop.  The main source of income for the business comes from butchering & selling pork in the local community.  T. has been engaged in this business for over 9 years and earns approximately 4,300,000 VND a month.


In 2008, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid her most recent loan from SEDA of 5,600,000 VND, which was used to invest in expanding the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND, which will be used for the same purpose.  This will be T.’s 4th loan from SEDA.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ngô

texts.en:
Thư Ngô Thị is a 35-year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, Thư owns & operates a business making & selling food.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling rice products in the local community.  She has been engaged in this business for over 11 years and earns approximately 3,600,000 VND a month.


In 2008, Thư  joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,600,000 VND from SEDA, which was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,496,000 VND, which will be used for the same purpose.  This will be Thư’s 4th loan from SEDA.  She  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve and expand it.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Sithat

texts.en: Mrs. Sithat M. and her husband are silk weavers. They have been married since 2000 and have two sons, both of whom are in school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  They sell their finished silk products to a middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Sithat has had two previous loans from Kiva. She is now asking for her third loan in the amount of $200 to purchase more silk.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom C., 49 years old, lives in the capital city of Phnom Penh. She owns a small store inside the local market where she sells a variety of cakes. She generates a profit of approximately US $5 a day to help support her family’s daily expenses with more stability. Mom C. has a life partner in her husband who sells fish sauce around his community. The couple helps each other in order to earn money to support their three children who attend school. Mom C. will be using part of this loan to improve her cake business and the rest to increase the capital of her husband's business.

loans.use: To improve her cake business and increase the capital of her husband's business

loans.name: Jerryline

texts.en:
Jerryline A. is from the village of San Miguel, Gingoog City. She is 20 years old, widowed and has 3 very young children. Jerryline owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop. She sells both food and daily use products and also makes and sells home-made sausages or chorizo in the local community. Jerryline has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Jerryline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jerryline is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Jerryline from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Thouk

texts.en:
Mrs. Thouk S. is a widow with three sons and three daughters: three are married and live in separate homes, two work in Phnom Penh City and one attends school.

Mrs. Thouk S. has asked for a Kiva loan once before to purchase weaving materials (cotton thread) for her weaving business. She is applying for her second loan of $400 to make repairs to her house. It is it difficult for the family to live in it since it is old and broken in some parts.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
D. Nguyễn Thị (20209050021) is a 38-year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. D. owns and operates a business raising livestock for sale. D. has been engaged in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 3,400,000 VND a month from it.

In 2008, D. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  D. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,600,000 VND from SEDA, which was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. D. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 4th loan taken out by D. from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


D. Nguyễn Thị (20209050021) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, D. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  D. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 12 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, D. kiếm được khoảng 3.400.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, D. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  D. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  D. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện điều kiện sống chung của gia đình người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma T. is from the village of Pandan, Gingoog City. She is 35 years old. Erma is separated from her spouse and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Erma owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling and dealing in personal products such as blankets and pillows cases in the local community. Erma has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Erma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Erma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Erma is requesting a new loan of 16000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Erma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Mr. Som S. R., 27, is an electronic repairman who learned his skills in a private school. He owns a small workshop in his home where he fixes all types of electronic material. He is married to R. Lay, a 27-year-old garment laborer, and they are blessed with one young child who is enrolled in school. Som S. R. has faced difficulties traveling to buy anything for his service or to get anywhere else because he doesn’t have his own vehicle. He dreams of having a motorcycle, but he can’t make that possible due to his saving is not being able to enough to buy one. Therefore, Som S. R. decided to request a loan which will enable him to afford purchasing a new motorcycle.

loans.use: To afford purchasing a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita D. is a married woman who lives in Tangkong II, Barangay Sillon, Bantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: a general store and a pig fattening business. Her husband, Manuel D., who is 50 years old, works as a family driver to earn his living and he also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 2 children who are 24 and 26 years old. 

Conchita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 cycle loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Conchita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 22,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 17th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, which she intends to use as additional capital so that she can continue to save up for their future and to fight the daily battle of their lives. Conchita D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia O. is a 59-year old married woman who supports her family by operating 3 business ventures: a TV & Refrigerator repair shop, Farming and a General Store business. She lives in T. Alonzo St., Poblacion, Madredijos, Cebu City. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her TV & Refrigerator repair shop, Farming and General Store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP5,000. 

Lydia is now borrowing PHP 23,000 so that she could use it to purchase additional materials for her business. This will be her 18th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP20,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Lydia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

Shown in photo: Lydia together with her husband in her shop. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị (20211020035) is a 23 year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. T. is the group leader of a 6 member group, which has requested a loan from SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ngô Nội nhóm 06 (Nhóm 06).

T. is married and has one infant-aged child. To making a living, T. owns and operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing and selling wood products to local businesses and community members. T. has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2009, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.496.000 VND which will also be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. The loan will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support extended members of her family.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. Nguyễn Thị Huê (0) is a 34 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.

2. Nguyễn Thị D. (0) is a 48 year-old female who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3. Nguyễn Thị C. (0) is a 40 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.

4. Nghiêm Thị O. (0) is a 38 year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a tailoring business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

T. Nguyễn Thị (20211020035) là 23 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ngô Nội nhóm 06 (Nhóm 06).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của C. việc kinh dO. chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng gỗ cho các dO. nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. T. thực hiện C. việc kinh dO. này trong hơn 3 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND. Vào 2009, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh dO. của cô ấy/ anh ấy. T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.496.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. Nguyễn Thị Huê (0) là 34 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ C. việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

2. Nguyễn Thị Ánh (0) là 38 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.840.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ C. việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3. Nguyễn Thị D. (0) là 48 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ C. việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là chăn nuôi gia súc.

4. Nguyễn Thị C. (0) là 40 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ C. việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là vận hành C. việc kinh dO. chế tạo hàng nội thất.

5. Nghiêm Thị O. (0) là 38 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.048.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ C. việc kinh dO. trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh dO. là vận hành C. việc kinh dO. may mặc.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các DO. Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ C. các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. .

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia E. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Lerio, Brgy. Vito, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: buying and selling religious articles, vegetable vending and running a general store.

Cecilia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Cecilia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.

This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing PHP 21,000 which she intends to use as additional capital for her religious articles business. Her goal is to continue to save up for their future, provide a good education for her children and to sustain their daily needs.

Cecilia E. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (dungganon is a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rom

texts.en:
Mr. K. is a 30-year-old married man and a local villager. He lives in a medium-sized home with his family members in the capital, Phnom Penh. He owns a piece of farmland that he inherited many years ago from his grandparents. He uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. Additionally, K. also takes time to operate a motor-taxi service for extra income. Another source of family income is from his wife’s job; she sews clothes.

Recently, K.’s taxi has been breaking down, which has negatively affected his income. Thus, K. is seeking a loan to replace his old taxi. K. will invest any remaining cash from the loan in his farm.

Mr. K. was busy working when the photo taken, so his wife is pictured instead.

loans.use: To replace an old taxi.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn A. is from the village of Cahulugan, Gingoog City. She is 28 years old. Jovelyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jovelyn owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products to the local community. Jovelyn has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Jovelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to build up her working capital. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Jovelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to build working capital

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia C. is a widow with five children between the ages of 27-36 years old. Four of her children have their own families while her fifth child helps her mother with her business. Lydia lives in Purok Ipil-Ipil, a part of Barangay Bulanon in Sagay City, Negros Occidental province on the Visayas islands. She earns a living through her fishing operation.

Lydia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1995 because she aspired for a better life for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lydia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.

This time, for her 18th loan cycle she is borrowing PHP 25,000, which she intends to use to purchase fishing materials so that she can continue to save up for the business and her family. Lydia C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en: Là Nguyễn Thị is a 34-year-old woman living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Tỉnh Bắc Ninh. She is married and has two school-age children. To making a living, Là owns and operates a general store selling both food and daily use products in her community. Là has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 4.000.000 dong (VND) a month. In 2009, Là joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Là has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA which was used to purchase products to sell. Là is now requesting a new loan of 8.288.000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her second loan from SEDA. Là plans to use the additional revenue to financially support immediate members of her family. No. 20211020031. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Là Nguyễn Thị (20211020031) là 34 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học. Để kiếm sống, Là Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán cả hai loại thức ăn & các nhu yếu phẩm trong cộng đồng địa phương. Là thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Là kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND một tháng. Vào 2009, Là đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Là đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Là dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh hỗ trợ tài chính cho các thành viên gần gũi trong gia đình của người vay. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen C. is a married woman who lives in Purok 4, Masaling, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: buying and selling livestock, grains and rice. Her husband Harley, who is 51 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are 27 to 31 years old. 

Carmen joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Carmen has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 22,000 ,which she intends to use for expansion of her rice, grains and livestock businesses so that she can continue to save up for their future and to purchase land which will be used for farming. Carmen C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To expand her rice, grains and livestock businesses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pon

texts.en:
Mrs. Pon N. is a young woman who is pictured here with her husband (on the right of the photo). This couple has spent their life cultivating crops. This is a skill they learned from their grandparents. The couple married several years ago and they now have two school-aged children.

Each year, the family plants and cultivates new crops, which has brought them great success. They are able to plant the crops at least twice a year, following both the rainy and dry seasons.

While the coming rainfall is good for growing, Pon N. does not have capital yet to use on her farm. Therefore, Pon N. is looking for a loan to use toward purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
C. Nguyễn Thị (20211040037) is a 35 year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. C. is the group leader of a four member group. They are seeking a loan from SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tiên Trà nhóm 03 (Nhóm 03).

C. is married and has three adult-aged children. To making a living, C. owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from raising cattle to sell. C. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, C. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. C. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.360.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. She is now requesting a new loan of 3.808.000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be the third she has taken out from SEDA. C. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. Nguyễn Thị N. (0) is a 36 year-old female who is requesting a 3.360.000 VND loan to support her business providing waste management services.

2. Trần Thị M. (0) is a 27 year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3. Nguyễn Thị Mỵ (0) is a 45 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in the rural areas outside of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

loans.name: Anilyn

texts.en:
Anilyn B. is from the village of Villa Corazon. She is 48 years old. Anilyn is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Anilyn owns & operates a weaving business selling sedge mats & mattresses to tourists and local community members. Anilyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Anilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Anilyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Anilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (20211040002) is a 40-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  H. is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Tiên Trà nhóm 01 (Nhóm 01).


H. is married and has 2 adult children. She owns & operates a livestock business, raising chickens for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2.000.000 VND a month.


In 2008, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6.048.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.048.000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  The will be the 2nd loan taken out by H. from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nghiêm Thị H. (0) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Ngô Thị T. (0) is a 36-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Nguyễn Thị (20211040002) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Tiên Trà nhóm 01 (Nhóm 01).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 20 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 6.048.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.048.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nghiêm Thị H. (0) là 34 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Ngô Thị T. (0) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .
