She describes herself as a friendly woman. Her goal is to improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more bags of beans and wheat

loans.name: Bendiya 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe BENDIYA 6 sont des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans, en moyenne 2  enfants et qui vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à MOSSIBOUGOU un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé a été bien remboursé.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : le niébé, le riz, l’arachide et le pois sucré avec KONIBA K..
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, les petits matériels et recruter de la main d'œuvre  pour entretenir : 1, 7  hectare . 
La production est vendue à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes après la récolte ,au marché de LOULOUNI. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 92 750 FCFA par campagne.
Son  bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The six members of the BENDIYA 6 group are married women with an average age of 25. They each have an average of 2 children and most of them live in polygamous families in Mossibougou, one of the villages in the commune of Loulouni in the Sikasso Region of southern Mali. They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their agricultural activities during winter. This is their second loan with the institution, with the first being duly repaid. The crops they invest in are: niebe beans, rice, peanuts and pois sucre nuts. Koniba K. intends to use her loan to purchase the agricultural products, tools and labour required to cultivate 1.7 hectares. The produce is sold after the harvest to a mixed clientele of men and women at the Loulouni market. She hopes to generate an average profit of 92 750 FCFA each season. The profit will enable her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from French by Kate Bennett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Frais de labour, semences, engrais, herbicides, sarclage et petits matériels agricoles.

loans.name: Foo-Mar. Group

texts.en:
Mary G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'Foo-Mar'. Mary is 48 years old, widowed, and has four children who range from 9 to 30 years old. She was not privileged to attend school due to poverty. She cares for 10 grandchildren. 

For 18 years, she has been selling 'fufu', (a kind of local food produced from cassava) in Redlight Market, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 10,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 38,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of cassava for 'fufu'.

She describes herself as a jovial woman. Her goal is to improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cassava for 'fufu'

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es: Freddy tiene 37 años, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijas en una casa alquilada. Desde hace 12 años brinda el servicio de transporte con su movilidad que es su principal herramienta de trabajo. Desde entonces trabaja todos los días recorriendo los diferentes puntos de la ciudad y con la experiencia de los años que tiene sabe como trabajar de manera eficiente logrando así obtener las ganancias  que requiere  para el sustento económico de su familia. Sin embargo debe afrontar el alza del combustible en algunas temporadas, afectándole mucho en su economía. Ahora su mayor anhelo es adquirir una nueva movilidad de transportes pero a gas, para que le resulte más económico. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de repuestos y el pago del mantenimiento mecánico de su carro.
texts.en:
Freddy is 37 years old. He lives with his wife and his 3 daughters in a rented house. For the past 12 years, he has provided transportation services with his own vehicle, which is his principal working tool. During that time, he has worked every day traveling through different parts of the city. With years of experience, he knows how to work efficiently, and thus he can obtain the profits he needs to support his family economically. However, he has been faced with a rise in fuel prices in some seasons, which seriously affects his budget. Currently, his greatest desire is to acquire a new vehicle, but one that runs on gas, which will be more economical. This is his second loan with MFP, and he is very happy to know that he has a source of financial support, because he has always shown himself to be responsible with his payments. He is also happy to be part of his communal bank, because all of its members are responsible people with a strong sense of solidarity. He is grateful to everyone who will help make this loan possible. It will be very useful to him in the progress of his business. With the funds he is requseting, he will invest in buying spare parts and paying for mechanical maintenance for his car.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying spare parts and providing mechanical maintenance for his car

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es: Maria José tiene 28 años, vive con sus 2 hijos hace más de 2 años se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, la decisión de tener un negocio fue porque necesitaba un ingreso más y poder superar con mayor facilidad los ingresos necesario para el hogar. Maria está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, además agradece a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de más productos como calzado, ropa interior, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos.
texts.en:
María José, 28, lives with her two children. She has sold general merchandise for over two years. She decided to open her own business because she needed extra income to meet household expenses more easily. María is very happy to know that she can count on having financial support because she has always been responsible with her repayments. In addition, she is grateful to all those people who will fund the loan she is requesting which will be very useful for her business. She will use the requested funds to buy more merchandise like: shoes, underwear, perfumes, creams and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise like: shoes, underwear, perfumes, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Personal Expenses

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is married with two children and one dependent. His two children are currently in primary school.

Francis is both a businessman and a clergyman and owns a shop where he sells home products. Francis' wife assists him greatly by taking care of the home when he is working at his shop.

Francis has a good loan repayment history; he needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL to help him buy more stock, as his customer base has been growing and he would like to satisfy their needs.

Francis hopes to use the proceeds from this loan to help educate his children and to complete building his house.

loans.use: To buy more home product to sell

loans.name: Fortunata Marcela

texts.es:
La Señora Marcela se dedica hace siete años a elaborar prendas de tejidos a base de lana e hilo, esta iniciativa se debió a la falta de empleo de su pareja que estuvo así por unos meses; seguir manteniendo a su familia era necesario, como toda madre Marcela trabajó mucho para darles lo necesario a sus hijos. Al comienzo no tenía muchas ventas porque sus prendas eran vendidos solo a sus conocidos, poco a poco a través de estas amistades fue captando más clientes, es así que en la actualidad estas prendas son exportadas a España por clientes fijos como chompas, boleros, gorros, tapetes, ponchos, lo que es una gran ayuda para solventar los gastos. Nos cuenta que también los fines de semana se dedica a la agricultura.
El primer préstamo que recibió lo invirtió en comprar lanas que le hacía falta para la confección de chompas para adultos y niños; gracias a estos trabajos le dio estudio técnico a su hijo de 22 años quien ya culminó su carrera; de igual manera sigue apoyando a su ultima hija quien estudia en la escuela. El préstamo que necesita es para invertir en hilos de colores, palitos de tejer; además para la preparación académica a su última hija quien postulará a la universidad. 
Una de sus metas que espera alcanzar Marcela es alquilar un puesto de negocio en un lugar céntrico de Chosica para extender sus prendas, materiales, además dictar clases como profesora de manualidades y tejidos.
texts.en:
Marcela has knitted woolen clothing articles for the last 7 years. She started this work when her life partner was unemployed for a few months. She needed to continue to support her family so, as any good mother would do, Marcela worked hard to provide for her children. At the beginning her sales were poor because she was selling her items just to acquaintances. Gradually, however, she began to get more customers through her friends. Currently, her items such as sweaters, vests, caps and placemats are exported to Spain by some of her regular customers; this is of great help to her in being able to meet household expenses. She comments that on weekends she also engages in farming. She used her first loan to buy wool she needed to make sweaters for children and adults. Thanks to this work she was able to pay for her 22-year-old son’s technical education; he has since completed his studies. Marcela continues to support her youngest daughter who is still in school. She needs the loan to buy yarn of various colors and knitting needles as well as for her youngest daughter’s academic preparation for she is planning to enter the university. One of Marcela’s goals is to rent a space for her business in central Chosica where she can offer her items for sale as well as teach knitting and crafts classes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy yarn in various colors and knitting needles.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI 1  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 4  enfants et  vivant dans des  familles polygames à SEREKENI un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution et  les  trois prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont :, le pois de terre et le riz  tel le cas de SITAN T..
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, les petits matériels et prendre des manœuvres  pour entretenir : 1h hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché de LOULOUNI après les récoltes à une clientèle composée de revendeurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 65 000fcfa  en fin de campagne.
Son bénéfice  lui permettra de payer son prêt et aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 1 group are married women with an average age of 39 and an average of four children, living in polygamous families in Serekeni, a village in the commune of Loulouni in the subprefecture of Loulouni (Third Administrative Region of Mali). They work with Soro Yiriwaso, a microfinance institution, to better organize their farming activity during the rains. This is their fourth loan; the three previous loans have been repaid fully. Sitan T. grows blackeyed peas and rice. With her loan she will buy fertilizer and small tools, and hire help to crop one hectare. Her produce will be sold in the village, and in the market in Loulouni to resellers. At the end of the season, she hopes for a profit of 65,000 FCFA, with which she will repay her loan and help her husband pay the day-to-day expenses of their family.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for seed, fertilizer, herbicide, tilling, weeding and hand tools

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe BENKADI 2  sont des femmes mariées  qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans ont en moyenne 4  enfants et vivent la plupart dans les  familles polygames à SEREKENI un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt et  les trois prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Le riz est la spéculation cultivée par KADIATOU B..
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et les petits matériels pour entretenir : 2 hectares . 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché de LOULOUNI à une clientèle composée  essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 70 000 FCFA en fin de  campagne.
Son bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt en plus de l'intérêt  et aussi à préparer le trousseau de mariage de ses filles.
texts.en:
The 10 members of this BENKADI 2 group are married women who have an average age of 39 and on average four children. They mostly live in polygamous families in SEREKENI, one of the villages in the township of LOULOUNI in the Sous-prefecture of LOULOUNI, third administrative region of Mali. They work with Soro Yiriwaso so as to better run their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan and the three preceding ones have been correctly reimbursed. Kadiatou B., one of the members of the group, cultivates rice. With her loan, she expects to buy inputs and small equipment to maintain two hectares. After the harvest, the production is sold in the village and at the market of Loulouni to a clientele composed essentially of middlemen who come from the big cities. Kadiatou expects to earn an average profit of 70,000 F CFA at the end of the season. Her profit will allow her to repay her loan and the interest and also to prepare a trousseau for her daughters.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of agricultural inputs and small equipment

loans.name: Sonnie Kamara Group

texts.en:
Sonnie K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'United'.  Sonnie is 39 years old, married, and has three children who range from 7 to 20 years old. She was not privileged to attend school due to poverty. She cares for one sibling. 

For 12 years, she has been selling a locally produced milk called 'sour milk' in Duport Road Community, Paynesville, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 10,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 51,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more milk.


She describes herself as a serious- minded woman. Her dream is to expand her business and continue to educate her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Grace P. is inset because she was absent during the meeting.

loans.use: To buy more milk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To  buy more bales of used clothing for her stall

loans.name: Benkadi 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI 3  sont des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 37ans, 3  enfants et qui vivent majoritairement dans des  familles polygames à SEREKENI un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution et les trois  prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
SALI BOURAMA T. fait la culture du riz.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et les petits matériels pour entretenir : 0,75 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village après les récoltes à une clientèle composée de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25.500 FCFA en fin de  campagne, qui lui permettra de payer son prêt et d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 3 group are married women, 37 years old on average with 3 children, and live mostly in polygamous households in Sekereni, one of the villages in the town of Loulouni, in the Loulouni sub-prefecture, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are work with Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners) to manage their agricultural businesses properly during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution, and the three previous loans were repaid properly. Sali Bourama T., one of the group members, grows rice. With her portion of the loan, she intends to buy agricultural inputs and small equipment to manage 0.75 hectares. The products are sold in the village after the harvest to a clientele composed of consumers. She intends to realize an average profit of 25,500 FCFA at the end of the planting season, which will allow her to repay the loan and help her husband with the family's expenses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy agricultural inputs and small equipment

loans.name: Kabirizi Kwetungura A, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
T. Bosco, a hardworking and cooperative 38-year-old married father of four children, has been operating a goat meat and pork butchery business from Byumba trading Centre in Kihihi for over seven years. He started his business with a little capital from his previous farming business.

Bosco buys goats and pigs from the surrounding villages which he slaughters and gets ready for selling to his genuine customers who have supported him this long. His business has grown to the extent that he has been able to have his children undergo education. He reveals that, in a month, he makes 360,000 Ugandan shillings and also makes some additional income through his side business.

Bosco’s drawback is having small stock of goats and pigs in his business. Therefore, would like to use this loan to restock his business by buying more animals for his daily butcher job. His future plans are to expand his business and improve his sales revenue.

loans.use: To purchase more animals for his butchery, especially goats and pigs

loans.name: Kabirizi Kwetungura B, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
A respectful and very hardworking B. Vianah, aged 35 years, is a married mother of two children.

Vianah operates a retail shop business from Kabirizi Trading centre selling general merchandise, especially items for home use, like basins, jerrycans, cups, buckets, groceries, sugar, salt and more. She started this business four years ago using her tea-growing sales business and, at the end of every month, she is able to pocket profits to the tune of 160,000 Ugandan shillings.

Vianah’s main drawback has been having a small stock in her business that cannot match the purchasing rate of her customers. She is therefore seeking a loan that she figures will help her to stock more goods that will satisfy the customers’ high demand and also transform her enterprise into a big enterprise.

Being very committed to the business with good customer care, Vianah hopes to increase her sales revenue. This will bring about a transformation in her business and enable her to achieve a self-sustaining life and cater for her family’s requirements especially to fulfill her dream of educating her children.

loans.use: To restock her business with items like sugar, drinks, salt, and so on

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI 4  est constitué  de 10 femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 31ans, 2  enfants et vivant dans des  familles polygames à SEREKENI un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution et  les  trois prêts précédents  se sont bien dénoués.
Les spéculations cultivées  sont le pois de terre et le riz avec MARIAM B..
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, les petits matériels et solliciter le concours de la main d’oeuvre  pour entretenir : 1hectare . 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au marché de LOULOUNI à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 55.500FCFA en fin de  campagne, qui  lui servira à payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The Benkadi 4 group is composed of 10 married women who are, on average, 31 years old with 2 children and live in polygamous households in Serekeni, one of the villages in the town of Loulouni, in the Loulouni sub-prefecture, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners) to manage their agricultural businesses properly during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution, and the three previous loans were repaid properly. Mariam B., one of the group members grows Bambara groundnuts and rice. With her portion of the loan, she intends to buy agricultural inputs and small equipment, and also to seek manual labour to manage 1 hectare of farmland. After the harvest, the products are sold at the Loulouni market to a clientele composed of men and women. She intends to realize an average profit of 55,500 FCFA at the end of the planting season, which will serve to repay her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for labour costs, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, hoes, and small agricultural equipment

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI 5 sont des femmes mariées  qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 37ans, ont en moyenne 3  enfants et vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à SEREKENI un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Le riz est la spéculation cultivée par ROKIA C., la présidente du groupe.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, les petits matériels et recruter de la main d'œuvre  pour entretenir : 1hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché de LOULOUNI après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 65 000 FCFA en fin de  campagne.
Son bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 5 group are married women, 37 years old on average with 3 children, and live mostly in polygamous households in Sekereni, one of the villages in the town of Loulouni, in the Loulouni sub-prefecture, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners) to manage their agricultural businesses properly during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution, and the previous loans were repaid properly. Rokia C., the president of the group, grows rice. With her portion of the loan, she intends to buy agricultural inputs and small equipment, and also to recruit manual labour to manage 1 hectare of farmland. The products are sold in the village and at the Loulouni market after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women. She intends to realize a profit of 65,000 FCFA at the end of the planting season. Her profit will allow her to repay the loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses. She hopes to maintain this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso in order to make use of the larger social and cultural setting and thus acquire better gains.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for labour costs, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, hoes, and small agricultural equipment

loans.name: Antonia Del Carmen

texts.es: Antonia Del Carmen tiene 55 años, de sus 4 hijos solamente 1 está a su cargo y cursa el primer año de secundaria. Su actividad económica es la venta de calzado. Ella tiene más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que fue como una alternativa de fuente de ingresos para su familia, esta no es la primera vez que tiene experiencia en financiamiento, pues siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar su condición de vida. Este crédito será invertido para la compra de sandalias, zapatillas, zapatos deportivos, zapatos para vestir entre otros.
texts.en:
Antonia Del Carmen, 55, only has one of her four children, who is in first year of secondary school, still under her care. She is a footwear merchant. She has been in this line of work for over 11 years. It is a way for her to have an alternative source of income for her family. This isn’t her first experience with financing because she is always seeking out ways to improve her living conditions. She will use this loan to buy sandals, slippers, athletic shoes, dress shoes, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted footwear.

loans.name: Benkadi 6 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI 6  est constitué de 10 femmes mariées  qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 32ans, ont en moyenne 3  enfants et qui vivent majoritairement  dans des  familles polygames à SEREKENI un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les trois prêts passés se sont  bien dénoués.
FANTA B.., la présidente du groupe cultive  le riz comme spéculation. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et les petits matériels pour entretenir : 0,5 hectare . 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché de LOULOUNI après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 30 000 FCFA en fin de campagne.
Son bénéfice lui servira à payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The Benkadi 6 group is composed of 10 married women who are, on average, 32 years old with 3 children and live primarily in polygamous households in Serekeni, one of the villages in the town of Loulouni, in the Loulouni sub-prefecture, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners) to manage their agricultural businesses properly during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution, and the three previous loans were repaid properly. Fanta B., the president of the group, grows rice as a crop. With her portion of the loan, she intends to buy agricultural inputs and small equipment to manage 0.5 hectares of farmland. After the harvest, the products are sold in the village and at the Loulouni market to a clientele composed of men and women. She intends to realize a profit of 30,000 FCFA at the end of the planting season. Her profits will serve to repay her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses. She hopes to maintain this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso in order to benefit from a larger cultural and social space, and thereby acquire better gains.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy agricultural inputs and small equipment

loans.name: Guillermina Del Carmen

texts.es: El señor C. N. reside en el Municipio de Catarina, labora en la alcaldía de la misma localidad como adminisionista  en el Mirador, con el salario que gana mantiene a su familia, el ahorita solicita un crédito con CEPRODEL para solventas unos gastos personales que le salieron y no quiere mandar su imagen  ya que es una persona muy responsable.
texts.en:
Mr. C. N. lives in the Catarina municipality. He works for the city as an admission clerk at El Mirador. With his salary he supports his family. He is now requesting a loan with CEPRODEL to pay for some personal expenses that came up. He does not want to send his picture. He is a very responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Benkadi 7 Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf membres du groupe BENKADI 7 sont des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 38ans en moyenne 4 enfants et qui vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à SEREKENI un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés se sont  bien dénoués.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : le pois sucré, le niébé, l’arachide et le riz  avec  SETOU B..
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et les petits matériels pour entretenir : 0,75 hectare . 
La production est vendue après la récolte au niveau du village à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 57 500FCFA en fin de campagne.
Son bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et aussi aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales. 
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The nine members of the Benkadi 7 group are married women, 38 years old on average with 4 children, and live primarily in polygamous households in Serekeni, one of the villages in the town of Loulouni, in the Loulouni sub-prefecture, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners) to carry through their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution, and the previous loans were repaid properly. Setou B., one of the group members, grows sugar snap peas, black-eyed peas, peanuts, and rice. With her portion of the loan, she intends to buy agricultural inputs and small equipment to manage 0.75 hectares of farmland. After the harvest, the products are sold in the village to a clientele composed of men and women. She intends to realize a profit of 57,500 FCFA at the end of the planting season. Her profits will serve to repay her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses. She hopes to maintain this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso in order to benefit from a larger cultural and social space, and thereby acquire better gains.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy agricultural inputs and small equipment

loans.name: María Etelvia

texts.es:
María Etelvina es una madre de familia de 46 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a su hijo en el sector El Sandial, un centro poblado rural del distrito de Pítipo, un distrito agrícola de la provincia de Ferreñafe, se encuentra ubicado a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a labores asociadas a la gricultura desde hace ocho años, actualmente cuenta con un terreno de cultivo donde suele sembrar diversos granos como maíz, por ejemplo. Adicionalmente cría pavillas (gallinas de guinea), un tipo de ave doméstica cuya carne es bastante estimada en la zona. Ella se vale de estas dos actividades para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de su familia.

María desea instalar en su parcela el cultivo de maíz, para ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y pesticidas ya que ya cuenta con semillas. Con mucho esfuerzo ella espera lograr una buena producción.

Maria es una mujer trabajadora y bastante entregada a su familia, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para ayudarlos a progresar y salir adelante. En la zona donde vive es considerada una persona tranquila y confiable. En la imagen nos muestra el terreno donde inslalara su cultivo y las aves que comercializa.
texts.en:
María Etelvina, 46, is a mother living with her husband and son in El Sandial, a rural populated area of Pitipo district which is an agricultural district of Ferreñafe province located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. She has been a farmer for the last 8 years. She has a field where she plants various grains like corn, for example. In addition, she raises guinea hens, a type of domestic fowl whose meat is quite popular in the area. These activities make it possible for her to help her husband support the family. María would like to plant corn in her field. To do so, she has approached Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to solicit funds. She needs 1000 new soles to buy fertilizers and pesticides since she already has seed. She expects to have a good crop yield thanks to the amount of effort she plans to exert. María is a hard working woman who is quite dedicated to her family. Her greatest wish is to continue working to help them and continue to progress. She is considered to be a levelheaded, trustworthy person by her neighbors. In the photo she shows us the field where she plans to plant her crops and the guinea hens she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for corn crop maintenance.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 49 años, vive al lado de su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 12 años trabaja en la venta de artículos de uso medico como: jeringas, guantes quirúrgicos, fármacos, etc. La modalidad de sus ventas lo realiza en cada visita que da a sus los hospitales, farmacias, consultorios médicos, etc.; siendo estos vendidos al por mayor. Su jornada laborar es durante todo el día, de lunes a viernes y descansa los fines de semana. Como una mujer de negocios es madre a la vez, y no descuida la atención de sus hijos. Es por ello que distribuye su horario para no descuidar su hogar. Ana manifiesta que es un negocio rentable y una buena fuente de ingresos ya que cuenta con los contactos necesarios para sus ventas  por lo que se ha proyectado a futuro ser una gran abastecedora de productos médicos. Es su séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de mas mercadería  ya que tiene mas pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana, 49, lives with her husband and two children in her own house. For the last 12 years she has sold medical supplies like: syringes, surgical gloves, medicines, etc. The way she operates is this: she visits hospitals, pharmacies and doctor’s offices and at each visit she sells at wholesale. She works all day, every day, from Monday through Friday. She rests on weekends. As a businesswoman and a mother, she does not neglect her children so she sets up her schedule in such a way that she does not neglect her home. Ana states that her business is profitable and a good source of income because she has regular customers. She is projecting for the future becoming a major supplier of medical supplies. This is her 7th loan with MFP. She is happy to know that she can count on financial support because she has always been responsible with her repayments. In addition, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all of her fellow members are responsible and mutually supportive. She is grateful to all the people that will fund the loan which will be very useful for her business. She will use the requested funds to buy more merchandise since she has more pending customer orders.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on medical supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For personal expenses.

loans.name: Magua En Desarrollo Group

texts.en:
Ivelisse is the coordinator of her group 'Magua en Desarrollo' 2 & 3, 'Magua in Development' (Magua is the name of her community). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner. She says that her most difficult challenge was to start with her business; at first, she didn't have the economic opportunity to do it.  In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying being at home, relaxing.

Ivelisse is excited to be taking out her 8th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for almost 4 years,  and she started it with her first loan in Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying clothing like pants (specially jeans), shirts, and some shoes. She will use the profit to invest in more clothes and to add more products, also she needs to buy various things for her home.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because she wanted to have a business and her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable  electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: to buy clothing (jeans, pants, shirts, and others) for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For personal expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia tiene 60 años, vive al lado de su esposo y sus 2 hijas en su casa propia. Hace 21 años prepara diferente platos típicos, en el cual los vende en la puerta de su casa. Desde entonces y todas las la mañanas realiza esta actividad y por las tardes, su esposo la apoya  en distribuir estos alimentos a los casas o comercio donde se ubican sus clientes. Cada  día  tiene una rutina diaria, además al término del día debe conseguir los materiales y productos necesarios para la preparación de comida del siguiente día. Su puesto de ventas se ubica en su misma casa, ubicada frente a una avenida muy transitada de su ciudad, eso le da la ventaja que sus ventas sean exitosas. En adelante planea mejorar su negocio en un local de ventas más amplio. Es su octavo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de ingredientes no perecibles, como: arroz, azúcar, menestras, fideos, entre otros.
texts.en:
Delia, 60, lives with her husband and two daughters in her own house. For the last 21 years she has prepared typical regional foods that she sells in her front yard every morning and afternoon. Her husband helps her deliver some of the meals to homes and businesses where some of her customers are located. Her daily routine is the same. At the end of each day she must get the supplies and ingredients for next day’s preparation. Her sales stand in located in her home which is along one of the city’s busiest streets. This is an advantage for her and leads to successful sales. For the future, she’d like to set up her business in a larger space. This is her 8th loan with MFP. She is happy to know that she has financial support because she has always been very responsible with her repayments. In addition, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all of its members are responsible and mutually supportive. She is grateful to all the people who will fund the loan she is requesting that will be very useful for her business’ progress. She will use the requested funds to buy non-perishable ingredients like: rice, sugar, pasta, vegetables, among others.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, pasta and vegetables.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es una madre de familia de 39 años de edad que vive juntos a tu esposo y a sus hijos en el sector El Sandial, una zona rural perteneciente al distrito de Pítipo, ubicado dentro de la provincia de Ferreñafe. La zona se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Al igual que la mayor parte de pobladores de la zona se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura, ella cuenta con un terreno de corta extensión donde suele sembrar maíz, adicionalmente cría ganado vacuno lechero, el cual vende a los negociantes de la zona, adcionalmente comercializa también la leche que producen. Con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía familiar.

Mercedes desea brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de maíz adquiriendo fertilizantes y pesticidas, los cuales aplicará a su cultivo para garantizarse una buena producción, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternartiva un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Mercedes es una mujer entregada a su familia y que siempre ha trabajado arduamente para verlos crecer y salir adelante. En la zona es una persona que suele ser solidaria con sus vecinos, razón por la cual estos la estiman mucho. En la imagen nos muestra los animale que actualmente posee.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 39, is a mother who lives with her husband and children in El Sandial, a rural sector of Pítipo district, located in Ferreñafe province. The area is an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. Like most area residents, she is a farmer. She has a small field where she plants corn. In addition, she raises dairy cattle for sale to area merchants. She also sells the milk the cows produce. Income from these activities helps her husband support the family. Mercedes wants to maintain her corn crops buying fertilizers and pesticides that she will apply to the soil in order to guarantee a good crop yield. To reach this goal she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 500 new sol, loan. Mercedes is a woman who is dedicated to her family and is always working hard to see them grow and develop. She tends to be very supportive of her neighbors in the area for which she is held in high esteem. In the photo, she shows the animals she currently has.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for corn crop maintenance.

loans.name: David

texts.es: David A. C., tiene la edad de 28 años, está soltero, no tiene hijos. Vive con sus padres. El crédito lo quiere compra de  abono, fungicidas y semillas para granos básicos. La idea es  darle mantenimiento  al cultivo de granos básicos, específicamente para maíz y frijoles.   Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don David tiene varios años de experiencia en la agricultura y está seguro de que le va a ir muy bien en esta nueva oportunidad que se le presenta. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
David A. C., age 28, is single and does not have children. He lives with his parents. He wants the loan to buy fertilizer, fungicide, and seeds for basic grains. His plan is to give maintenance to his basic grains crops, especially corn and beans. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR, and he is very happy with the terms of the loan. David has several years of experience in agriculture. He is sure that this new opportunity will go very well for him. In the future he hopes to give his family a better quality of life and greater financial stability. He wants to be able to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plant and maintenance of basic grains

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 53 años, vive con su hijo en la casa de un familiar. Desde hace 7 años vende comida, en donde adecuo un espacio para su propio restaurante en su mismo domicilio. Su hijo es su apoyo principal y cada día se esfuerza en la preparación y atención  a la clientela. Lo que le agrada de su trabajo, es su sentido de esfuerzo que cada día tiene y se pone el reto de lograr que todas las porciones de comida que ha preparado se vendan en ese día,  ya que de eso depende la rentabilidad de su jornada. Por tal motivo se siente contenta y se proyecta para el futuro ampliar y que sea mas acogedor su restaurante. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de ingredientes no perecibles para la preparación de comida.
texts.en:
Gladys, 53, lives with her son in a relative’s house. For the last 7 years she has sold food in a space in her home that she set up as an eatery. Her son is her main helper and every day she strives to prepare the best meals and provide customer service. What she enjoys about her work is the effort she puts into her daily preparations facing the challenge of insuring that all her meals are sold daily since that is what her profitability depends on. She is happy, therefore, and plans for the future to expand and make her eatery more attractive. This is her 1st loan with MFP. She is happy to know that she can count on having financial support. In addition, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all of its members are responsible, mutually supportive persons. She is grateful to all the people who will fund the loan she is requesting in that it will be very useful for her business. She will use the requested funds to buy non-perishable items needed in her food preparations.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy non-perishables.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 50 años, vive con su hija en su casa propia. Hace más de 4 años vende cerveza, pero este negocio no le satisfacía, hace que paso dos años mas y emprendió la venta de mercería, artículos para el arreglo personal. Su hija, quien su principal apoyo, siempre la acompaña a realizar sus ventas, siendo en diversos puntos de su ciudad, así como en las ferias comerciales. De esta manera logra tener los ingresos que necesita para su economía, afirma que le agrada trabajar de manera independiente y con los años de experiencia le han enseñado a administrar su capital. En adelante espera tener un puesto estable para que pueda trabajar tranquilamente. Es su cuarto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá para incrementar su capital de trabajo  ya que se abastecerá de mercadería comprando en cantidades.
texts.en:
Isabel is 50 years old, and she lives with her daughter in a house that she owns. More than 4 years ago she was selling beer, but she was not satisfied with this activity and so after two more years she started selling haberdashery and personal beauty products. Her daughter, her first assistant, always accompanies her when she travels to different parts of the city and to commercial fairs to sell her products. This is how she succeeds in earning the money she needs to face her expenses. She says that she likes working independently, and that the years of experience she has gained have taught her how to administer her capital. In the future she hopes she will have a fixed stall in order to work with no worries. This is her fourth loan with MFP: she is very happy to know she can count on economic support as she has always shown responsibility with her repayments; she also likes being a member of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and very caring people. She is thankful to the people who will manage the loan she is requesting, which will be very useful to make her activity grow. The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her working capital, as she will refurnish her stock by buy large quantities of products.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy core products.

loans.name: Marina Lizbeth

texts.es: Marina Lizbeth tiene 22 años, su actividad es la venta de recargas telefónicas. Hace mas de 2 años que tiene este negocio, es así que diariamente trabaja brindando este servicio, ya sea en el exterior de su casa o en su pequeño establecimiento, generalmente este trabajo lo realiza hasta las 3 de la tarde ya que luego se dispone a realizar este servicio a domicilio, en donde le toma el resto de día que le queda. Afirma que le agrada trabajar en este servicio porque es un área que conoce bastante además de que se siente respaldada por la experiencia de varios años en esta actividad. Es su primer crédito, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá para compra de materia prima para más recargas que sus clientes solicitan.
texts.en:
Marina Lizbeth is 22 years old and sells cell phone top-up cards. She’s had this business for more than two years and she works daily, whether it be from the front of her home or from within a small establishment. She works [from the establishment] until 3:00 in the afternoon, and then goes door to door. This takes up the rest of her day. She tells us that she enjoys providing this service because it’s a business that she knows very well and she’s backed by several years of experience. This will be her first loan and she is very happy to know that she has financial backing. She has always been responsible with her payments and will use the money from this loan to invest in more top-up cards that her customers have requested.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jovanna

texts.es: Jovanna es una joven de 26 años, vive en compañía de sus padres en casa de ellos. Hace dos años empezó a trabajar de manera independiente, forjando su propio restaurante, en donde su madre la apoya en la atención. De esta manera y todos los días se dedica a preparar comida, al gusto y preferencia del cliente. En las mañanas se abastece de los ingredientes necesarios para prepara el almuerzo, una vez terminada sus ventas, limpia los platos y demás trastos para tener todo listo para mañana. Manifiesta que aunque el trabajo sea agotador, lo considera una distracción, poro tanto su anhelo es mejorar el aspecto de su establecimiento. Es su quinto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de mercadería, como gaseosas, asimismo comprar sillas.
texts.en:
Jovanna is a young woman of 26. She lives with her parents in their house. Two years ago, she began to work independently, opening her own restaurant, where her mother helps her serve customers. Thus, every day she works preparing food to suit her customers' tastes and preferences. During the mornings, she stocks up on the necessary ingredients to prepare lunch. Once her sales have finished, she washes the dishes and other items so that everything will be ready for the next day. She reports that although her work is tiring, she finds it enjoyable. Her desire for the future is to improve the appearance of her establishment. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that she has a source of financial support, since she has always shown herself to be responsible with her payments. She is also happy to be part of her communal bank, because all of its members are responsible people with a strong sense of solidarity. She is grateful to all of the people who will make this loan possible. It will be very useful to her in further developing her business. With the loan she is requesting, she will invest in buying supplies, such as soft drinks, and she will also buy chairs.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying soft drinks and chairs

loans.name: Sope Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE MAME DIARRA est créé le 04 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 12 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Elles ont formé leur groupe par copinage et par voisinage. 

Madame NDEYE LOBE G., debout à l'extrême droite de la photo, est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge. 

Elle fait de l'embouche bovine et ovine. Elle pratique cette activité depuis son entrée dans le Banc Villageois il y a trois ans de cela.

Avec son prêt de 200.000 francs CFA elle va acheter un bœuf et deux moutons. Elle va les emboucher pendant au moins 5 mois avant de les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaire de sa localité.

Avec ses bénéfices elle va participer à l'amélioration des condition de vie de sa famille. Par exemple la nourriture et l'habillement des enfants. En sus, elle verse mensuellement une épargne au niveau de son Banc Villageois.
texts.en:
The Sope Mame Diarra solidarity group was created on 4th December 2007. It is made up of 12 women who are all from the same village, and who are all friends or neighbors. Mrs. Ndeye Lobe G., who is standing at the extreme right of the photo, is in charge of the group. She is 43 years old, married and mother to five children, who are in her care. She has a beef and sheep fattening business, which she has carried out since she joined the Banc Villageois three years ago. With her 200,000 francs loan she is going to buy an ox and two sheep. She will fatten them up for at least five months before reselling them at the weekly markets in her town. With the profits she makes she will contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions. She will, for instance, be able to contribute to the costs of feeding and clothing the children. Furthermore, she saves money each month with her Banc Villageois.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an ox and two sheep

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto C. E., tiene 30 años.  Es soltero y vive con los padres,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo, Gabriel (8). 

Luis es un socio de la ventanilla rural la “Valle Alto”, que está ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz y arroz. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz y arroz. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener dinero para comprar un terreno. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y las enfermedades en sus cultivos como el gusano cogollero.
Le gusta jugar fútbol los fines de semana.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto C. E. is 30 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in the Ventanas province in Los Ríos. He has one son, Gabriel, 8. Luis is a member of the rural communal bank 'Valle Alto' (High Valley), which is located in the Voluntad de Dios precinct, 1.5 hours from Ventanas. There are 23 members in the group in total, and the majority work in agriculture. This is the second loan they are seeking from Cooperativa San José. Luis works in agriculture, growing maize and rice. He makes his purchases each month in Ventanas city and sells in the same location. He is seeking this loan to invest in the purchase of maize and rice, and thinks that the loan is an opportunity to improve his situation. His dreams are to have money to purchase a plot of land. In the way of his dreams are the plagues and diseases that affect his crops, such as the cogollero worm. Luis likes to play soccer on the weekends.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase maize and rice

loans.name: Hilda Leopoldina

texts.es:
Hilda Leopoldina C. F., tiene 22 años.  Es soltera y vive con los padres y los hijos,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos, Ana (7), Cristian (3) y Kimberly (6 meses).
 
Hilda es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Valle Alto”, que está ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Hilda se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener dinero para comprar un terreno. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y las enfermedades en sus cultivos como el gusano cogollero.

Le gusta jugar fútbol los fines de semana.
texts.en:
Hilda Leopoldina C. F. is 22 years old. She is single and lives with her parents and children in the Ventanas province in Los Ríos. She has 3 children - Ana, 7, Cristian, 3, and Kimberly, 6. Hilda is a member of the rural community bank 'Valle Alto' (High Valley), located in the Voluntad de Dios precinct, 1.5 hours from Ventanas. There are 23 members in total, and the majority work in agriculture. This is the second loan that they have received from Cooperativa San José. Hilda works in agriculture, growing maize. She makes her purchases each month in Ventanas city and sells in the same place. She is seeking a loan to invest in the purchase of maize. She views the loan as an opportunity to improve her situation. Her dreams are to have money to purchase a plot of land. Blocking her goals are the plagues and diseases that affect her crops, such as the cogollero worm. Hilda likes to play soccer on the weekends.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase maize

loans.name: G.s. Quintana Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Q. está conformado por Elida Luisa y Sandra Esther. Ambas se dedican a la venta de mercadería en general, pues las dos tienen bastante tiempo de ser amigas, Sandra tiene 2 años preocupada por ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios, tuvo esta idea. Ella sale a vender todos los días sus diferentes productos, dice que es una gran ayuda para ella, además quisiera tener más inventario y mejorar el servicio para sus clientes. Elida al principio vendía solamente pocos productos pero ahora tiene más cosas, pues juntas han decidido realizar este financiamiento para la compra de  materia prima como pantalones, ropa interior, calzados, perfumes, toallas y sabanas.
texts.en:
The united Q. group is made up of Elida Luisa and Sandra Esther. Both of them sell general merchandise and have been friends for a long time. For two years, Sandra has been worried about helping her children with their schooling and had this idea. She goes out daily to sell different products. She says that it's a great help to her and would like to have a greater inventory. She also wants to improve her customer service. Elida has been selling fewer products, but now she has more items. They have decided to request this loan together, so that they can buy additional items, such as pants, underclothing, shoes, perfumes, towels and sheets.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Yimmy Geovanny

texts.es:
Yimmy Geovanny C. F., tiene 20 años.  Es soltera y vive con los padres,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. No tiene  hijo. 

Yimmy es un socio de la ventanilla rural la “Valle Alto”, que está ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Yimmy se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz en ciclo corto. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños superarse en los estudios y terminar la universidad. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y las enfermedades en sus cultivos como la variedad del clima

Le gusta jugar fútbol los fines de semana.
texts.en:
Yimmy Geovanny C. F. is twenty years old. He is single without children and lives with his parents. He lives in Ventanas a province in Los Rios. Yimmy is a partner in the Valle Alto rural bank which is located in Recinto Voluntad de Dios, an hour and a half away from Ventanas. There are 23 partners in all most of whom work in the agricultural sector. This will be their second loan with the San Jose Cooperative. Yimmy works in agriculture; he grows corn that grows on a short cycle. He makes his purchases every month in the city of Ventanas, and he sells his product there too. He is applying for a loan to purchase corn seeds. He believes that the loan is an opportunity to improve his life. HIs dreams are to continue with his studies and finish university. His business faces difficulties such as infestations, diseased plants, and the variability of the weather. He likes to play soccer on the weekends.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn for planting

loans.name: Mujeres Adelante Al Progreso 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Benuat is the coordinator of his group "Mujeres adelante al progreso" 1 & 2 "Forward towards progress women". This Esperanza associate began with us because he was looking for a loan to invest in his business and his  story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. He says that his most difficult challenges are to help his community to develop more access and services.

Benuat is excited to be taking his 10th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. He has had his business for over 6 years, starting up with some savings. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business by buying clothes and perfumes for men and women, cosmetics and some shoes. He will use the profits to invest in his business and to build a house. In his future, he sees himself running a big store. 

His group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activities are a free trade zone, a cement factory, and others. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: to buy clothes, etc. for resale

loans.name: Gladys Azucena

texts.es:
Gladys Azucena Z. V., tiene 38 años.  Es casada y vive con el esposo y los hijos,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos, Catherine y Gabriel. 

Gladys es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Valle Alto”, que está ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Gladys se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz y fréjol. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz, y fréjol. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños sacar adelante a los hijos y comprar un  terreno. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y las enfermedades en sus cultivos como gusano, y otras enfermedades.

Le gusta hacer deporte con los niños.
texts.en:
Gladys Azucena Z. V. is 38 years old. She is married and has two children, Catherine and Gabriel. They live in Ventanas in the province of Los Rios. Gladys is a partner in the Valle Alto rural bank, which is located in Recinto Voluntad de Dios an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are a total of 23 partners most of whom work in agriculture. This is the second loan that they are applying for with the San Jose Cooperative. Gladys works growing corn and beans. She makes her purchases once a month in Vnetanas and sells her produce there too. She will use the loan to purchase seeds to grow corn and beans. She believes that the loan is a great opportunity to improve her life. Her dreams are to help her children succeed and to purchase a plot of land. Her business faces challenges like infestations and plant diseases such as worms. In her spare time she likes to play sports with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn and beans for planting

loans.name: Bonny Tatiana

texts.es:
Bonny Tatiana C. M., tiene 21 años.  Estado civil union libre y vive con el compañero y los hijos,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos, Nelly (8)y Gabriel (7). 

Tatiana es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Valle Alto”, que está ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Tatiana se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz arroz y fréjol. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños comprar una casa y poner un negocio en la ciudad de Ventanas. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y las enfermedades en sus cultivos como gusano, y otras enfermedades.

Le gusta trabajar y escuchar la palabra de Dios.
texts.en:
Bonny Tatiana C. M. is 21 years old. She lives in free union with her partner and her two children, Nelly (8) and Gabriel (7). They live in Ventanas in the province of Los Rios. Tatiana is a member of the Valle Alto rural bank, which is located in Recinto Voluntad de Dios an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are a total of 23 members, most of whom are farmers. This will be their second loan with the San Jose Cooperative. Tatiana works in agriculture growing corn, rice, and beans. She makes her purchases and sales every month in Ventanas. She will use the loan to purchase corn, rice, and beans. She believes that the loan provides her with an opportunity to improve her life. Her dreams are to purchase a house and start a business in Ventanas. Her farming business faces challenges like insect infestations and diseases. She likes to work and attend church services.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds (corn, rice, and beans)

loans.name: Glenda Yadira

texts.es:
Glenda Yadira, A. C. tiene 21 años.  Es soltera y vive con los hijos,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos, Manuel y Wendy.

Glenda es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Valle Alto”, que está ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Glenda se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz gandul y arroz. Realiza sus compras cada mes en comercial Peña, en la ciudad de Ventanas y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz, gandul y arroz. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños comprar una casa y un terreno. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y las enfermedades en sus cultivos como gusano, y otras enfermedades.

Le gusta hacer deporte y escuchar música.
texts.en:
Glenda Yadira A. C. is 21 years old. She is single and has two children, Manuel and Wendy. They live in Ventanas in the province of Los Rios. Glenda is a member of the Valle Alto rural bank, which is located in Recinto Voluntad de DIos an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are a total of 23 members, most of whom work in agriculture. This will be their second loan with the San Jose Cooperative. Glenda is a farmer and grows corn, pigeon peas, and rice. She makes her purchases every month at the Peña Store in Ventanas and sells her produce in the same shop. She will use the loan money to purchase seeds for her different crops. She thinks that this loan is a great opportunity to improve her life. Her dream is to purchase a house and a plot of land. Her business faces challenges primarily infestations and plant diseases such as worms. She likes to play sports and listen to music in her free time.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds (corn, peas, and rice)

loans.name: Mujeres Adelante Al Progreso 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Julia is the coordinator of her group Mujeres adelante al Progreso 3 & 4 (Forward to the progress women). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and 3 children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to work hard to help her family (her children and husband).  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying cooking for them.

Julia is excited to be taking her 7th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for over 4 years, starting with her first loan in Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying flour, oil, chicken, some vegetables and other meat. She has a fried food stand. She will use the profits to invest in her business, and for the future she is planning to have her home and a restaurant.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because she needed money to invest in her business and her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in San Pedro D. Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activities are a free traD. zone, a cement factory, and others. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, flour, oil, etc.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Victor Manuel A. A., tiene 37 años.  Es soltero y vive con los hijos,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos, Katerin y Mónica.

Victor  es un socio de la ventanilla rural la “Valle Alto”, que está ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Victor se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz y fréjol. Realiza sus compras cada mes en comercial Peña, en la ciudad de Ventanas y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra semillas de  arroz y fréjol. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños comprar un carro y ponerse un negocio en la ciudad de Ventanas. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Victor Manuel A. A. is 37 years old. He is single and lives with his two daughters Katerin and Monica. He lives in Ventanas in the province of Los Rios. Victor is a partner in the Valle Alto rural bank, which is located in Recinto Voluntad de Dios an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 23 partners in all, most of whom work in agriculture. This will be their second loan with the San Jose Cooperative. Victor is a farmer, and he grows rice and beans. He makes his purchase every month in the Peña Store in the city of Ventanas; he sells his produce to the same shop. He is applying for the loan to purchase rice and bean seeds. He believes that the loan is an opportnity to improve his life. HIs dreams are to purchase a car and open a business in Ventanas. His business faces challenges, primarily infestations and plant diseases. He enjoys playing sports.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice and bean seeds

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria Magdalena A. A., tiene 37 años.  Es soltera y vive con los hijos,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 5 hijos, Estefani (1), Maribel (20), Mayra (16), Angi (12) y Jose (22).

Maria  es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Valle Alto”, que está ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz y maíz. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas y las vende en la misma localidad a precios muy convenientes.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra semillas de  arroz y maíz. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños comprar una casa y ponerse un negocio en la ciudad de Ventanas. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades.

Le gusta vender productos AVON y YAMBAL y le gusta observar como hacen deporte las personas de la localidad donde vive.
texts.en:
Maria Magdalena A. A. is 37 years old. She is single and lives with her children. She lives in Ventanas, in Los Ríos province. She has 5 children, Estefani (1), Maribel (20), Mayra (16), Angi (12) and Jose (22). Maria is a member of the “Valle Alto” ["High Valley"] rural solidarity group, which is located in the neighborhood of Voluntad de Dios, an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 23 members in all, most of whom work in agriculture. This is their second loan with the San José Cooperative. Maria works in agriculture, growing rice and corn. She makes her purchases every month in the town of Ventanas, and she sells her products in the same place at very favorable prices. She is requesting the loan to invest in buying seeds for rice and corn. She thinks that the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. Her dreams are to buy a house and set up a business in the town of Ventanas. Some of the challenges she confronts are plant pests and diseases. She likes to sell AVON and YAMBAL products, and she likes to watch the people in her neighborhood playing sports.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying rice and corn seeds

loans.name: Prudencio

texts.es: Prudencio tiene 59 años, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en casa  de un familiar. Se dedica en la venta de piezas de carros desde hace 10 años. Estas piezas las adquiere de las compras que hace en algunas carrocerías y almacenes de carros viejos en desuso, para luego revenderlas por partes en talleres mecánicos de su zona y a un mayor precio. En ocasiones su hijo mayor le ayuda, pero su principal instrumento de trabajo es su camioneta que le sirve para transportar las pesadas piezas o chatarras de los carros. Adicionalmente a este trabajo, compra y vende  objetos reciclados, aprovechando que la gente que lo conoce, siempre van a dejar un objeto viejo o malogrado. Prudencio ha visto la rentabilidad de su negocio en todos estos años por lo que se ha decidió implementar con más herramienta.  Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. El crédito que solicita lo complementará con unos ahorros que tiene para lograr comprarse un carro nuevo, ya que el actual que tiene esta muy viejo.
texts.en:
Prudencio is 59 years old and lives with his wife and three children. He’s been in the business of selling car parts for the past 10 years. He gets these parts by buying old cars from junk yards and obsolete automobile warehouses, then sells the to car repair shops within his zone parts for a profit. Sometimes his son helps him, but he primarily uses his van to transport the heavy pieces or metal parts. He also buys and sells related items, taking advantage of the fact that people who know him often drop off old or unneeded items to him. Prudencio has seen the profitability of his business over the past few years because he decided to work with more tools. This will be his first loan through MFP and he is very happy to know that he has financial support. He is also happy to be a part of a communal group because all of its members are responsible and very supportive. He is also grateful to those people who are making this loan possible; it will be very helpful for the advancement of his business. He will use the money from this loan, along with money from his own savings to buy a new car because the one he has now is too old.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Completar el pago de un carro nuevo.

loans.name: Carlos Armando

texts.es:
Carlos Armando B. C., tiene 21 años.  Es soltero y vive con los padres,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. No tiene  hijo.
